[FEW persons]198-few persons ( [Hammond]57-mr. hammond said ) are truthful ; yet [the complete and experienced liar]199-the complete and experienced liar is rare . A really great lie , whether acted or spoken , is the supreme expression of a nature . It is an inspiration of genius . [I]0-i make [my]0-i bow to it with [my]0-i hand on [my]0-i heart . And all this reminds [me]0-i of [a man whom [I]0-i once knew called [Leversedge]58-leversedge]200-a man whom i once knew called leversedge — [Constantine Leversedge]58-leversedge . For although [he]58-leversedge told , consciously at all events , no lies , [he]58-leversedge was intimately involved in the telling of [one of a really superior order]201-one of a really superior order . And [a young lady]202-a young lady , eminently distinguished for the ripeness of [her]202-a young lady modernity , was involved in it also . [I]0-i met [Leversedge]58-leversedge in [London]1-london once in a way . Then [he]58-leversedge would disappear for an indefinite period , to return — very long and lean and brown — furnished with a vocabulary floridly rich in abusive epithets applicable to South African society . [He]58-leversedge had business , as [I]0-i understood , in [those savage regions]203-those savage regions . And it must have proved remunerative , for [he]58-leversedge gave an increasing impression of prosperity each time [I]0-i saw [him]58-leversedge . But whether it consisted in exploiting [the aborigines]204-the aborigines , digging for diamonds , pulling the tail feathers out of live ostriches , or undertaking dental operations on dead elephants , [I]0-i never exactly knew . [He]58-leversedge grew rich , voilà tout ; and [he]58-leversedge really was [a charming fellow]205-a charming fellow , though [his]58-leversedge appearance always seemed to imply the near neighbourhood of a horse — a thing which [I]0-i , personally , find slightly irritating . For [I]0-i have no drop of the blood of the Centaurs in [me]0-i . [I]0-i gravitate naturally , as [you]206-you may say , to [my]0-i own feet or to wheels . So that [a being half equine]207-a being half equine , as are so many of [the members of [our]209-our great race]208-the members of our great race , produces in [me]0-i an annoying sense of the limitations of [my]0-i opportunities . This , however , is a digression.—It remains that [this man Leversedge]210-this man leversedge had just that hint of a stoop about the shoulders , indolent fashion of moving , and slightly distracted look across the eyes and brow which [riding - men]211-riding - men so frequently have . [He]58-leversedge had more legs , too , than are absolutely requisite in civilised society . [I]0-i may mention , in passing , that [he]58-leversedge was delightfully clean ; that [his]58-leversedge almost black beard was neatly trimmed , while [his]58-leversedge moustache , which was a quite bright brown , stood rather gallantly away from it . Had [you]206-you arrayed [him]58-leversedge in white ruff and trunk - hose [he]58-leversedge would have made [an admirable Elizabethan adventurer]212-an admirable elizabethan adventurer . Pardon these details , since it is necessary to the appreciation of what follows that [you]206-you should see the creature “ in [his]58-leversedge habit as [he]58-leversedge lived . ”[58-leversedge] The last time [I]0-i met [Leversedge]58-leversedge was at [a large summer hotel on [the Lake of [Geneva]2-geneva]214-the lake of geneva]213-a large summer hotel on the lake of geneva . [It]213-a large summer hotel on the lake of geneva is a very commendable dwelling - place,—according to the style of such things,—situated in [several acres of garden that stretch down to and along [the lake shore]216-the lake shore]215-several acres of garden that stretch down to and along the lake shore . [I]0-i abstain from localising [it]213-a large summer hotel on the lake of geneva more particularly , for [Leversedge]58-leversedge 's is not a name to conjure with there . Quite unintentionally [he]58-leversedge spoilt [the manager]217-the manager 's season for [him]58-leversedge . Even [the British and American tourist]218-the british and american tourist , matter - of - fact animal though it is , has its superstitions . [[My]0-i friend]219-my friend 's eccentric action aroused [them]218-the british and american tourist , aroused [them]218-the british and american tourist to the extent of making [the owners of [them]218-the british and american tourist]220-the owners of them run away . For [he]58-leversedge caused life suddenly to dip to the tragic level — a thoughtless thing to do at any time , an almost criminal one at [a summer hotel]221-a summer hotel . But [I]0-i am getting [the cart]222-the cart before the horse . All that came later . Immediately , [Leversedge]58-leversedge appeared to be in the very heyday of success . [He]58-leversedge had attained . [He]58-leversedge had made [his]58-leversedge pile . The elephants and ostriches and [South Africans]223-south africans , white or black , had receded into the Great Inane . The diamonds had receded also , saving and excepting the considerable store of those delightful stones that [he]58-leversedge had brought along with [him]58-leversedge , and destined for the delectation and adornment of [[his]58-leversedge bride]224-his bride . For [Leversedge]58-leversedge 's tastes were innocent , innocent to the point of matrimony . [He]58-leversedge was engaged to [a young lady]202-a young lady , by name [Miss Charlotte Perry,—playfully]59-charlotte addressed by [[her]202-a young lady father]226-her father in moments of expansion as “ [carissima Carlotta mia,”—had]59-charlotte[202-a young lady] been so engaged for quite a number of years . Now [he]58-leversedge was about to marry [her]202-a young lady , a proceeding which , subject to the fact of a protracted engagement , really touches the high - water mark of innocence , does n't it ? [[The Perry]60-miss perry parents]227-the perry parents , [I]0-i regret to say , struck [me]0-i as leaving something to be desired . [Leversedge]58-leversedge had offered to take [the best suite of rooms in [the house]229-the house]228-the best suite of rooms in the house for [them]227-the perry parents ; and [they]227-the perry parents had , perhaps consequently , shown considerable alacrity in coming this far to meet [him]58-leversedge on [his]58-leversedge homeward journey . [They]227-the perry parents were [a rather dusty - looking couple]230-a rather dusty - looking couple . [He]58-leversedge a voracious , adhesive little rat of [a man , with a lop - sided way of walking]231-a man , with a lop - sided way of walking , a coat - collar insufficiently brushed at all times , and a waistcoat to match after meals . [He]58-leversedge smiled upon [one]232-one ravenously ; and told many stock stories of [witty bishops]233-witty bishops and [Conservative politicians]234-conservative politicians , giving [[his]58-leversedge audience]235-his audience to understand [he]58-leversedge had [himself]58-leversedge invariably acted [Horatio]61-horatio to [the Hamlet of [these good and great men]237-these good and great men]236-the hamlet of these good and great men . [Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry was in another style . Dusty too , but round - about and kindly ; of an expansive , middle - class figure , and a countenance resembling a moon on a clock - face . A suburban moon , be it added , of the very honestest sort , wholly unsymbolic of the worship of [Artemis]63-artemis or [Astarte]64-astarte , without phases , standing ever at a guileless full . But if in outward aspect [this worthy pair]238-this worthy pair was divided , in sentiment [they]227-the perry parents were one — in as far , at least , as sentiment related to [[their]227-the perry parents fair daughter]239-their fair daughter ; for [they]227-the perry parents reverenced [her]239-their fair daughter as the supreme expression of [their]227-the perry parents highest selves . And there was something genuinely touching in the whole - heartedness of that reverence , in [their]227-the perry parents whispered confidences regarding the effect of [her]239-their fair daughter beauty , the widespread recognition of [her]239-their fair daughter talents , the brilliancy of [her]239-their fair daughter social successes . If one might accept the witness of [these good parents]240-these good parents , the life of [London]1-london , intellectual and artistic , pulsed with profounder colour and thrilled into more vigorous effort when [Charlotte Perry]65-charlotte passed along . According to [them]227-the perry parents , [Walter Creighton]66-walter creighton extolled [her]239-their fair daughter pastels , and even that harshest of [critics]241-critics , [James Colthurst]67-james colthurst , praised [her]239-their fair daughter draughtsmanship ; while [Zeltingen]68-zeltingen had been heard , more than once , to protest that if [she]239-their fair daughter played in public [his]68-zeltingen reputation as [a pianist]242-a pianist would be completely gone . At [Adolphus Carr]69-adolphus carr 's Wednesday afternoons [she]239-their fair daughter was [a more than welcome guest]243-a more than welcome guest ; and [Mrs. Septimus Mertyns]70-mrs. mertyns , [the wife of the distinguished Q.C. , whose [drawing - rooms in [Portland]3-portland Place so perpetually reverberate to the roarings of [lions young and old]246-lions young and old]245-drawing - rooms in portland place so perpetually reverberate to the roarings of lions young and old , could not be happy without [her]239-their fair daughter]244-the wife of the distinguished q.c. , whose drawing - rooms in portland place so perpetually reverberate to the roarings of lions young and old , could not be happy without her . [Given dearest Lotta]65-charlotte to help , [she]239-their fair daughter is reported to have declared [herself]239-their fair daughter equal to entertaining [the Immortals of all ages — without distinction of race , creed , or sex — and , what is more , of making a success of the affair]247-the immortals of all ages — without distinction of race , creed , or sex — and , what is more , of making a success of the affair . From all of which it may assuredly be gathered that [this accomplished young lady]248-this accomplished young lady had been designed by nature to fill some notable niche in contemporary history . And that provoked a little inward questioning as to whether [she]239-their fair daughter was equally designed by nature to be [the contented wife of [Constantine Leversedge]58-leversedge]249-the contented wife of constantine leversedge , with [his]58-leversedge distracted brow , and long legs , and probably very ordinary , primitive view of the marital relation . The thermometer , [I]0-i remember , stood rather persistently at 90 ° in the shade that summer,—a condition of the atmosphere which disposes one to the exclusive observation of objects in the immediate foreground , easily within the range of vision , that can be contemplated without the breaking of a decent repose , without the unlovely heatings of physical exertion . And therefore , [I]0-i suppose , [I]0-i began to observe [the Perry - Leversedge]71-leversedge drama rather closely . It was under [my]0-i hand . Daily it was round about [me]0-i . At first the action was languid . Suddenly unexpected elements introduced [themselves]250-themselves into the piece . IT happened thus . [Leversedge]58-leversedge was off duty . [He]58-leversedge and [I]0-i were alone , drinking [our]251-our coffee after luncheon in [the central hall of [the hotel]253-the hotel]252-the central hall of the hotel . It is [a very good hall , lighted from above by a glass roof]254-a very good hall , lighted from above by a glass roof . [The Perrys]72-the perrys had gone out to luncheon . [You]269-you may reach [the place]270-the place — [the Perrys]72-the perrys had done so — by means of an electric tram of phenomenal joltiness , the whirrings and hootings of which distract the sensitive ear from 7 A.M. to 9.30 at night . [Mrs. Mertyns]70-mrs. mertyns , like [the highland chieftain of legend or heroic story]271-the highland chieftain of legend or heroic story , had brought [her]70-mrs. mertyns tail along with [her]70-mrs. mertyns . A truly resplendent tail , socially and intellectually considered ; dazzling to the eyes of [Perry]71-leversedge père et mère , and even , in a degree , to the more experienced orbs of [the Carissima]272-the carissima also . [The Perrys]72-the perrys were bidden to meet the resplendent tail , and [the Perrys]72-the perrys went . [Leversedge]71-leversedge did not go . Being [a very true gentleman]280-a very true gentleman , [he]71-leversedge assumed that [he]71-leversedge had not cared to go . “ It was too hot,”—too[71-leversedge] hot , forsooth , for this sun - grilled being just [home]281-home from [the tropics]282-the tropics ! Whether [he]71-leversedge had not been included in the invitation , or whether [Miss Perry]60-miss perry had desired [him]71-leversedge to refuse it , offered food for speculation . [I]0-i could not determine . But [I]0-i observed that [he]71-leversedge was a trifle low in [his]71-leversedge mind as [he]71-leversedge sat in [that cool hall]283-that cool hall , among the palms and indiarubber plants , smoking the cigarette of peace and drinking black coffee . [His]71-leversedge talk ran on serious subjects . The irruption of [some lively children from out of [the lift]285-the lift]284-some lively children from out of the lift , accompanied by [French bonnes]286-french bonnes and [English governesses galore]287-english governesses galore , caused a pause in [our]288-us conversation . [Leversedge]71-leversedge was very fond of [children]289-children , a wholesome trait in [any man]290-any man 's character . [He]71-leversedge watched [them]289-children , and as [their]289-children cries and chatter died away out of doors in [the garden]291-the garden [he]71-leversedge asked [me]0-i — “ Do [you]292-you believe in [devils]1588-devils ? ”[71-leversedge] Now , this , if [you]292-you like , was serious . It almost amounted to being fundamental ; and [I]0-i own to an inherent distaste for formulating opinions upon fundamentals . “ A devil , [Leversedge]71-leversedge , ”[0-i] [I]0-i therefore playfully protested . “ Do n't let [us]288-us approach the question in the plural number . It becomes too complicated , too crowded . [One devil,—one]1589-one devil,—one surely is enough for all practical purposes ? In the singular [he]71-leversedge is precious , though archaic ; and , if only for dramatic and literary reasons , [I]71-leversedge do n't think [we]288-us can afford to abolish [him]71-leversedge . [He]71-leversedge supplies the dash of absolute black , [you]292-you see , which brings out all the delicate lights and shades of the moral picture . Without [him]71-leversedge the nuances would lose their values . No , [we]288-us must keep one . [He]71-leversedge may be of any size [you]292-you like,—quite a small one if [you]292-you wish it , a veritable little ewe - lamb of [a devil]1590-a devil . But for the sake of [his]71-leversedge colour,—I am getting slightly mixed as to sex , [I]71-leversedge fancy , but [my]71-leversedge knowledge of the sheepfold is scarcely professional,—well , of its colour , which is black , [you]292-you understand , uncompromising black , [I]71-leversedge implore that one , just one , may be spared to [us]288-us . ”[71-leversedge] [Leversedge]71-leversedge smiled upon [me]0-i , but in a spirit of gentle endurance . [His]71-leversedge pensiveness remained , unabated . “ [I]71-leversedge was not talking of property devils , ”[71-leversedge] [he]71-leversedge answered ; “ and they would hardly serve [your]292-you purpose anyhow ; for [they]1590-a devil seem to make them red nowadays , mostly , not black . [I]71-leversedge saw [Faust]76-faust last time [I]71-leversedge was [home]281-home , at [the Lyceum]1592-the lyceum ; but [I]71-leversedge did n't think [the scarlet variety patronised there]1593-the scarlet variety patronised there amounted to very much . They were altogether too solid . [You]292-you know , at a push [you]292-you could do for them,—shoot , or stick , or strangle [them]1593-the scarlet variety patronised there . [You]292-you must be [an uncommonly poor lot]1594-an uncommonly poor lot if [you]292-you find things frightening that [you]292-you could strangle . ”[71-leversedge] [He]71-leversedge smoked reflectively for a little . “ No , ”[71-leversedge] [he]71-leversedge went on ; “ [I]71-leversedge — [I]71-leversedge mean [you]292-you — [I]71-leversedge mean [nobody]1595-nobody 's afraid of what [they]1593-the scarlet variety patronised there can strangle . Even when [I]71-leversedge was [home]281-home last , [I]71-leversedge could have supplied [the management]1597-the management with the ground - plan of a much nastier species of fiend than those hairy , pudding - bodied creatures . And now — ”[71-leversedge] [Leversedge]71-leversedge 's voice caught with a click in [his]71-leversedge throat . [He]71-leversedge sprang to [his]71-leversedge feet , making a violent movement of both hands , as though forcing something heavy and clinging off [his]71-leversedge lap . “ Get down , ”[71-leversedge] [he]71-leversedge cried , “ [you]0-i brute,—you hideous brute . ”[71-leversedge] This was startling . But there are incidents which , while provoking curiosity almost to bursting - point , have about [them]293-them a gravity — a gravity born of [their]293-them very absurdity sometimes — which would effectually prevent any but [a double - soled idiot]294-a double - soled idiot making comments or asking questions . [I]0-i did neither . [Leversedge]71-leversedge had just spoken of [people]295-people being frightened ; and that more sympathetically than [I]0-i should have expected , for [he]71-leversedge was [himself]71-leversedge certainly [no poltroon]296-no poltroon . [He]71-leversedge was [a quiet , steady , sensible fellow]297-a quiet , steady , sensible fellow , [the kind of man to whom [women]299-women turn instinctively , as to a life - belt or lightning - conductor , in an emergency]298-the kind of man to whom women turn instinctively , as to a life - belt or lightning - conductor , in an emergency . Yet at this moment [his]71-leversedge face expressed fear , and more than fear . It expressed downright terror and uncontrollable disgust . Really [he]71-leversedge presented a very distressing spectacle . [His]71-leversedge mouth was slightly open , while [his]71-leversedge lips curled back queerly from [his]71-leversedge teeth . It may sound ridiculous , but [I]0-i could almost swear that [his]71-leversedge hair bristled . [His]71-leversedge action had been too rapid for premeditation . [I]0-i never doubted it was wholly spontaneous and honest . Still , [I]0-i knew — knew as positively as [I]0-i have ever known anything in [my]0-i life — that nothing , animate or inanimate , had been reposing upon [his]71-leversedge excellently white , flannel trousers . Knew , equally well , that nothing had slipped from off them on to the inlaid marble floor as , beating [his]71-leversedge knees , [he]71-leversedge lunged up out of the chair beside [me]0-i . [We]300-we had only just finished [our]300-we coffee . The tray and a flacon of cognac still stood on the table before [me]0-i . After about a minute [Leversedge]71-leversedge laid hold of the flacon , and emptied half its contents into one of the dirty coffee - cups . [He]71-leversedge gulped down the brandy , and wiped [his]71-leversedge moustache and beard — as well as [he]71-leversedge could , for [his]71-leversedge teeth were chattering and [his]71-leversedge hands shaking , like those of [a person in the cold fit of a fever]301-a person in the cold fit of a fever . Then [he]71-leversedge walked up and down the length of [the hall]302-the hall once or twice , fished a cane stool out from under one of the seats , came back and sat down beside [me]0-i again . [He]71-leversedge had entered into possession of [himself]71-leversedge . But [he]71-leversedge was still shaking . Then [Leversedge]78-leversedge said slowly — “ It began like this — [I]78-leversedge had been riding for a couple of days expecting to strike [a mining camp where [I]78-leversedge had business]1606-a mining camp where i had business . But [I]78-leversedge 'd fever on [me]78-leversedge , and got out of [my]78-leversedge course . Do [you]78-leversedge know [the Veldt]5-the veldt , [Hammond]57-mr. hammond ? Of course [you]78-leversedge don't — the endless roll of [the treeless land]1607-the treeless land , under the dome of the thick , tropic sky , both alike grey with the heavy , deadly heat . It gets [you]78-leversedge with a sort of despair . [You]78-leversedge look at it as [you]78-leversedge might look at a sentence of penal servitude for life . The monotony takes the heart out of [you]78-leversedge — that , and the heat , the killing heat . At last the hazy warming - pan of a sun went down , and the dark came quick , and [I]78-leversedge muddled on pretty well done . And , from the top of one of [those everlasting bare ridges]1608-those everlasting bare ridges , [I]78-leversedge saw the white tilts of a couple of waggons showing up about half a mile away . It was n't [[my]78-leversedge camp]1609-my camp , but it meant something in the way of rest and help . Those dreadful eyes looking up at [me]307-i — two yellowish - green discs galloping beside [me]307-i , dropping behind for a minute or two , coming up with [me]307-i again , mile after mile , all through the night . And the night seemed years and years long — ”[307-i] [I]0-i am afraid it is true , even with [the most civilised of [us]310-us]309-the most civilised of us , that the appetite for horror grows with what it feeds on . And [I]78-leversedge thought it was all right . [We]1627-us were a couple of degrees south of [the equator]1631-the equator , and there had been a bad electric storm which had made [us]1627-us all feel pretty jumpy ; but the rain had come down and the weather was mending . [Perry]60-miss perry père et mère were distinctly demoralised in aspect , and even [the Carissima]83-the carissima was not quite up to [her]83-the carissima usual level . [Miss Perry]60-miss perry looked warm , which was a pity , for it was not [her]60-miss perry rôle to look warm . It was [her]60-miss perry rôle to remind [you]327-you of sunrise rather than sunset , to be virginal , flower - like , [I]0-i might say dewy . [She]60-miss perry was tall ; and [[our]326-our grandmothers]328-our grandmothers , [I]0-i think , would have described [her]60-miss perry appearance as elegant , the more so that [her]60-miss perry shoulders sloped and that [her]60-miss perry features were somewhat indefinite . For truly , in [her]60-miss perry the paternal rat and the maternal clock - moon had mixed themselves to the point of uncertainty , the roundness of [the one]329-the one putting a perpetual check upon the sharpness of the other , and vice versâ — two affirmatives going to make a negative , if one may reverse the rule laid down in [our]326-our English grammar . [Her]60-miss perry colouring , on the other hand , was quite definite . It was red and brown . [I]0-i have heard it called Italian , or gipsy - like . [A budding poet]330-a budding poet once asserted , in dedicatory verse , that [her]60-miss perry complexion reminded [him]330-a budding poet of split pomegranates . But then , [poets]331-poets pay odd compliments — specially [young ones]332-young ones . [Miss Perry]60-miss perry 's hair was brown , and abundant . [Her]60-miss perry eyes were also brown , and the whites of them very white . They were extremely pretty eyes ; not large and placed flatly in [her]60-miss perry head , but dewy , almost always dewy , and full of appeal . In short , [she]60-miss perry was unquestionably [an uncommonly attractive young lady]333-an uncommonly attractive young lady , particularly at a little distance . [She]60-miss perry needed to be focussed — but nearly [every pretty woman]334-every pretty woman , like every good picture , needs that ! And [she]60-miss perry dressed well , though [her]60-miss perry clothes needed focussing too . At close quarters [they]335-they had an unhappy knack of looking new without looking quite fresh . [I]84-mr. perry regret to say so — but [you]84-mr. perry must have observed it [yourself]84-mr. perry , [Mr. Hammond]57-mr. hammond — [Constantine Leversedge]58-leversedge is obtuse , unhappily obtuse ; [he]58-leversedge is insufficiently sensible of [his]58-leversedge social privileges . But unfortunately it is not so . [He]58-leversedge displays , is displaying at this moment , in [my]84-mr. perry opinion , a lamentable indifference to an opportunity of cultivating a most valuable acquaintance . Unless [I]84-mr. perry am very much mistaken , six will be striking almost immediately . ”[84-mr. perry] Evidently this was serious . So [I]0-i tried to appease [Mr. Perry]84-mr. perry by remarking that , considering how exquisite [a companion]383-a companion [he]84-mr. perry possessed , [Leversedge]58-leversedge 's conduct was more than comprehensible , excusable , almost justifiable . For is not unpunctuality , as [I]0-i pointed out , the natural prerogative of [happy lovers]384-happy lovers ? For [them]384-happy lovers time has ceased . Eternity enfolds [them]384-happy lovers . How , then , can [they]384-happy lovers be expected to remember that wholly mechanical contrivance , the clock ? And , to pass from [the general]385-the general to the particular , was it altogether inconceivable that even [Mrs. Mertyns]70-mrs. mertyns might , at a push , recall faint memories of a period when to linger with [the great Septimus]386-the great septimus beyond the appointed time had been bliss ? Was [Perry]84-mr. perry [himself]84-mr. perry , indeed , entirely guiltless under this head ? [[The hotel boatman]399-the hotel boatman 's house]400-the hotel boatman 's house stands at one corner . As for [me]0-i , [I]0-i never run ; should not , [I]0-i imagine , were it even to clasp to [my]0-i heart [a potentially eloping daughter]407-a potentially eloping daughter — which thing , heaven , in its mercy , eternally forbid ! So [I]0-i followed [Mr. Perry]84-mr. perry , in all the calm dignity of the non - parental mind , along the lake path under quivering balsam - poplars and charmingly pendent willows , arriving at [the place of gnats]408-the place of gnats only in time to see [his]84-mr. perry lop - sided , little , black figure and the tall , cream - coloured one of the fair Charlotte speeding away , through sunshine and shadow , in the direction of [the hotel and social distinction]409-the hotel and social distinction . Verily , the ways of [Providence]94-providence are not equal ! [I]0-i had returned from [Evian]10-evian in a depressed frame of mind , as [I]0-i have already recorded . [I]0-i had started for [that agreeably mundane little watering - place]410-that agreeably mundane little watering - place in a somewhat Byronic humour , determined to do a trifle of living on [my]0-i own account . But the humour had not lasted . With [me]0-i it rarely does . Once on the spot , a spirit of pallid Platonism invaded [me]0-i , chilling to death all possibility of drama . It really was rather provoking , for [I]0-i love drama ; and the position had been worthy of one of those French comedies from which the heart must be extracted , during the process of adaptation for the English stage , if [young maidens]411-young maidens are to be spared anxiety when taking [members of [the elder generation]413-the elder generation]412-members of the elder generation to [the theatre]414-the theatre . [I]0-i had planned it all so nicely , yet nothing had come of it . And now , directly [I]0-i returned to [this innocent locality]415-this innocent locality , to these commonplace , not to say rather common , [people]295-people , [I]0-i found that , in full play which [I]0-i had vainly sought across [the water]382-the water . [Mr. Perry]84-mr. perry 's conversation had given [me]0-i food for thought . While one glance at [Leversedge]58-leversedge assured [me]0-i that for [him]58-leversedge the wheels had been going round during [my]0-i absence , going round to some purpose . [HE]58-leversedge had just beached [the boat]418-the boat , a gaudy emerald - green and buff affair with scarlet cushions to it , and stood in the shifting angular shadow of the plane trees , watching the receding figure of [the lady of [his]58-leversedge affections]419-the lady of his affections and that of [[his]58-leversedge prospective father - in - law]420-his prospective father - in - law . Then [his]58-leversedge chin dropped on [his]58-leversedge chest , and [he]58-leversedge stared vacantly at a pair of swans sailing about [the clear water of [the little harbour]424-the little harbour]423-the clear water of the little harbour , just back of [the row of gaily painted boats]425-the row of gaily painted boats — which creaked and bumped together as the slight wash from the beat of the birds ' black paddles took [them]421-they . [A good many of [us]427-our]426-a good many of us , [I]0-i suppose , as [we]427-our get on in life , have a face [[our]427-our friends]1747-our friends do not know , though [our]427-our looking - glasses do , when doors are shut and [the room]429-the room is empty . That is the face of [[our]427-our naked self]430-our naked self , and therefore it is somewhat indecent for any but [ourselves]427-our to behold it . [Leversedge]58-leversedge believed [himself]58-leversedge to be alone , [he]58-leversedge had let slip appearances , and [I]0-i beheld the face of [his]58-leversedge naked self . It was very interesting ; but , as things naked often will , it gave [me]0-i a shock . Not that there was anything evil in it . It held no revelation of cleverly veiled iniquities , no trace either of fox or [satyr]431-satyr . [The man]432-the man 's self bare was , like [the man]432-the man 's self clothed , cleanly , sober , and — on its own lines — not undignified . If sin was about , one judged [him]58-leversedge more likely to be sinned against than sinning ; which , so [the authorities]434-the authorities assure [us]427-our , “ is far better . ”[434-the authorities] But , in [his]58-leversedge case , even the farthest better was still but a poor best . For [Leversedge]58-leversedge looked hunted , looked tormented ; looked as [people will look after a disaster at sea , or a heavy shock of earthquake]435-people will look after a disaster at sea , or a heavy shock of earthquake ; looked as [those are reported to look who have seen a ghost]436-those are reported to look who have seen a ghost . Of course [we]427-our all join in denying the existence of the supernatural and relegating it to [the , at present somewhat over - populated , [country of Exploded Ideas]438-country of exploded ideas]437-the , at present somewhat over - populated , country of exploded ideas ; or only in permitting its existence in the form of some derangement of nerve ganglia or of the intestines . The pill , to put it concisely , has superseded the prayer — to the great advantage of the vender of patent medicines , whose advertisement - boards have so gracefully usurped the station of the wayside cross in modern English landscape . [I]0-i mention this in self - defence . For [Leversedge]58-leversedge certainly did look as though , in pre - scientific phrase , [he]58-leversedge had seen [a ghost]439-a ghost ; and [no one]440-no one knows better than [I]0-i do , [I]0-i need hardly say , that ghosts , like miracles , “ do not happen . ”[58-leversedge] Therefore [Leversedge]58-leversedge 's body must clearly have been playing [some fool]441-some fool 's trick on [Leversedge]58-leversedge 's brain ; and [Leversedge]58-leversedge , in being taken in and so harassed by such trickery was clearly guilty of a grave scientific misdemeanour . Demonstrably it was [my]0-i place to be angry with [him]58-leversedge , to convince [him]58-leversedge of foolishness . But [I]0-i did none of these things . [I]0-i own to it with contrition , [I]0-i was horribly sorry for [him]58-leversedge — that was all . And only the more sorry , when , suddenly awakening to the fact of [my]0-i presence , [he]58-leversedge gripped [himself]58-leversedge , left off contemplating the swans , accosted [me]0-i with as much nonchalance as [he]58-leversedge could muster ( not being [a very accomplished actor]442-a very accomplished actor ) ; while an almost defiant inquiry as to how much of the face of [his]58-leversedge naked self [I]0-i had beheld haunted [his]58-leversedge eyes . “ Oh , [I]58-leversedge beg [your]0-i pardon , [Hammond]57-mr. hammond ; [I]58-leversedge did n't see [you]0-i , ”[58-leversedge] [he]58-leversedge said . “ [We]1751-we 've been having a very jolly time out on [the water]382-the water . And , it may sound queer,”—he[58-leversedge] smiled rather sadly,-“but perhaps [you]0-i are never really more dependent upon [a woman]1776-a woman than when [you]0-i are a few thousand miles away from [her]1776-a woman . [You]0-i see , when [you]0-i are knocking about in countries where there is [not much public opinion to reckon with]1777-not much public opinion to reckon with [you]0-i are liable to be tempted to live a bit loosely ; and then [her]1776-a woman face comes before [you]0-i at all sorts of odd times , and [her]1776-a woman letters come . And [you]0-i spend hours planning what [you]0-i and [she]1776-a woman will do together when the parting is over and [you]0-i get back . The thought of [her]1776-a woman is the sweetness of [your]0-i life , and the salt of it too — it 's what makes the work worth while . [You]0-i see [other women]1778-other women , [nice women [some of [them,—dear women]1781-them,—dear women]1780-some of them,—dear women]1779-nice women some of them,—dear women , for [a lot of [women]299-women]1782-a lot of women are nice and dear,—and [they]1782-a lot of women 're good to [you]0-i sometimes ; but [they]1782-a lot of women are n't in it , [they]1782-a lot of women do n't count one bit . [He]58-leversedge did not wait for [my]0-i answer , but walked away beside [the breakwater water]452-the breakwater water — [his]58-leversedge figure long and white under the cool green shade of the plane trees . [I]0-i like [lovers]453-lovers . [Their]453-lovers antics rarely irritate [me]0-i . Even at [their]453-lovers worst [they]453-lovers are idiots to whom [I]0-i offer [myself]0-i quite willingly as an asylum , and invite , with open arms , to drivel on [my]0-i breast ; while , at [their]453-lovers best , [they]453-lovers ravish [my]0-i soul with satisfaction . In spirit [I]0-i build temples to [them]453-lovers , and worship prostrate , [my]0-i frivolous head in the dust . [I]0-i had erected [a quite imposing temple to [Leversedge]58-leversedge]454-a quite imposing temple to leversedge by the time [he]58-leversedge returned ; for it appeared to [me]0-i that , in [him]58-leversedge , [Providence]94-providence granted [me]0-i acquaintance with [a lover of a rather heroic type]455-a lover of a rather heroic type . If [the Beloved]456-the beloved was as fine as [the Lover]457-the lover , [I]0-i had hope . In that case [I]0-i snapped [my]0-i fingers at the diabolic dog . THE next day , as far as [I]0-i remember , passed without incident until evening . [I]0-i hold there is but one irremediable evil in life , that of growing tired of [oneself]488-oneself . [I]0-i therefore avoid it with great care , and , to that end , entirely refuse to grow accustomed to [my]0-i own idiosyncrasies . [I]0-i let [my]0-i characteristics take [me]0-i by surprise . [I]0-i am journalier to [myself]0-i , scorning stereotyped habits as [I]0-i would scorn to wear a livery . [I]0-i dread to be consistent as [I]0-i would dread paralysis . Quite [the last person of [my]0-i acquaintance with whom [I]0-i would ever risk being familiar]489-the last person of my acquaintance with whom i would ever risk being familiar is [myself]0-i ; and so [I]0-i study earnestly to cultivate a various mind , and give [my]0-i good qualities the slip equally with [my]0-i bad ones . To take a minor example . [I]0-i am naturally gregarious . The manners and customs of [[my]0-i fellow - mortals]490-my fellow - mortals afford [me]0-i permanent entertainment . Consequently [I]0-i woo solitude , and often seek a hermit hour . [I]0-i sought one , unsuccessfully , on the evening in question . It was damp out of doors , and [the more lively members of [the community]492-the community]491-the more lively members of the community had gathered in [the hall]302-the hall , the more serious in the salle de conversation , after dinner . At one end of [the hall]302-the hall , [a would - be prima - donna , of transatlantic extraction]497-a would - be prima - donna , of transatlantic extraction , reigned over [the American section of [the community]492-the community]498-the american section of the community , supported by [an elegant and obedient mother who had kept [her]500-an elegant and obedient mother who had kept her figure figure]500-an elegant and obedient mother who had kept her figure , [a good - tempered and obedient French composer who had lost [his]501-a good - tempered and obedient french composer who had lost his]501-a good - tempered and obedient french composer who had lost his , and [a disobedient French poodle who had followed suit]502-a disobedient french poodle who had followed suit . At the other end , [a venerable Russian poet , blessed with fine head and silvery beard]503-a venerable russian poet , blessed with fine head and silvery beard , [a man of really apostolic aspect]504-a man of really apostolic aspect — [he]504-a man of really apostolic aspect , for cause unknown , by the way , invariably wore brown kid , cut - fingered gloves — presided over a court of [three beautiful daughters]505-three beautiful daughters ; [a fierce , spare young woman in a scarlet silk blouse — [her]506-a fierce , spare young woman in a scarlet silk blouse — her wardrobe appeared limited — whose black hair hung in a thick pigtail , tied with scarlet ribbons , down her back to below her knees wardrobe appeared limited — whose black hair hung in a thick pigtail , tied with scarlet ribbons , down [her]506-a fierce , spare young woman in a scarlet silk blouse — her wardrobe appeared limited — whose black hair hung in a thick pigtail , tied with scarlet ribbons , down her back to below her knees back to below [her]506-a fierce , spare young woman in a scarlet silk blouse — her wardrobe appeared limited — whose black hair hung in a thick pigtail , tied with scarlet ribbons , down her back to below her knees knees]506-a fierce , spare young woman in a scarlet silk blouse — her wardrobe appeared limited — whose black hair hung in a thick pigtail , tied with scarlet ribbons , down her back to below her knees ; and [two young men , also Russian , of debilitated physique and excited bearing]507-two young men , also russian , of debilitated physique and excited bearing . The interspaces were filled in by [English]102-english — English , prickly or patronising , nervously dumb or nervously boisterous ; few , if any of [them]508-them , quite at [their]508-them ease . For it must be conceded that the number of [[our]509-our dear country - men]510-our dear country - men and [women who possess the gentle art of living gracefully in public]511-women who possess the gentle art of living gracefully in public is lamentably small . [Persons who , in the security of [[their]512-persons who , in the security of their moist island homes moist island homes]513-their moist island homes]512-persons who , in the security of their moist island homes , are well - bred and really quite delightful , become as awkward as chased hens in [an hotel]1730-an hotel . [Most English]515-most english are born with [their]515-most english feet glued to little round green stands , like [the ladies and gentlemen of [Noah]103-noah]516-the ladies and gentlemen of noah 's Ark. To see [them]515-most english unglued — as in foreign travel — is to see [them]515-most english at a disadvantage . For the stand is as necessary to [their]515-most english self - respect as [their]515-most english decent petticoats and irreproachable trousers . In [the hall]302-the hall [everyone]303-everyone talked . [The debilitated Russian young men]519-the debilitated russian young men did more . [They]519-the debilitated russian young men waved [their]519-the debilitated russian young men arms and shouted ; while [the spare young woman]520-the spare young woman alternately hissed and purred at [them]519-the debilitated russian young men , and waved , not [her]520-the spare young woman arms only , but [her]520-the spare young woman whole lithe body . This displeased [the poodle]521-the poodle — it was very disquieting — and caused [him]521-the poodle to bark , which caused [[his]521-the poodle mistress]522-his mistress to slap [him]521-the poodle . During the process [she]522-his mistress explained exactly why [she]522-his mistress slapped [him]521-the poodle to [[her]522-his mistress mother]359-her mother and all [[her]522-his mistress friends]524-her friends ; who on [their]519-the debilitated russian young men part continued chattering volubly to [her]522-his mistress and [[her]522-his mistress mother]359-her mother , and [the poodle]521-the poodle , and [each other]527-each other , and [the French composer]528-the french composer . [The latter]529-the latter laughed good - temperedly , with raised eyebrows , puffed at [his]521-the poodle cigar , furtively consoled [the poodle]521-the poodle , and tapped out airs from [his]521-the poodle coming opera upon the floor with the heel of [his]521-the poodle boot . In [the salon]531-the salon the style was different . [A retired Deputy Surgeon - General of the Madras Army]532-a retired deputy surgeon - general of the madras army , seated upon a gilded lounge upholstered in crimson and yellow ( the furniture of [the salon]531-the salon was slightly loud ) , held forth to [an elderly and respectable audience]534-an elderly and respectable audience upon the clear connection between [Mr. Gladstone]104-mr. gladstone and the “ little horn ”[104-mr. gladstone] in the Book of [the Prophet Daniel]105-the prophet daniel , the iniquities of the Opium Traffic , and the unfulfilled predictions in Revelations . [Good Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry was [a member of [[his]521-the poodle congregation]536-his congregation]535-a member of his congregation . [She]62-mrs. perry sat under the full glare of the gas chandelier . [She]62-mrs. perry was rubicund . [She]62-mrs. perry was beaming . Yet [she]62-mrs. perry appeared to [me]0-i worried . [Presumably Mr. Gladstone]104-mr. gladstone and [the “ little horn ”]1825-the “ little horn ”[62-mrs. perry] were too much for [her]62-mrs. perry . In that [she]62-mrs. perry surely did not stand alone . [I]0-i hurriedly crossed [the room]429-the room , and let [myself]0-i out by one of the glass doors on to [the long wide verandah]542-the long wide verandah . The change from the heat and noise and glare within was rather startling . A wet wind lashed through the balsam poplars bordering [the lake]370-the lake , swept over [the garden]291-the garden , and tormented the banks of shrubbery on either side [the large lawn]545-the large lawn . The leaves of the pyramidal magnolias upon [the terrace]546-the terrace slapped together , and the great odorous blossoms swayed ghostly in the half light . Flights of ragged cloud , fringed with watery yellow where they crossed the moon , fled across the sky . Gleams of white foam and a hoarseness of breaking waves came from [the shore]547-the shore . In a spirit of economy the lamps upon [the terrace]546-the terrace and [the verandah]549-the verandah had been left unlighted . Only a tawny brightness from the doors and windows of [the salon]531-the salon lay in broad stripes along [the marble pavement]551-the marble pavement , and touched the edges of the descending steps . [[We]552-we writers of little verses]553-we writers of little verses are addicted to exaggerating the moral and emotional significance of [Nature]106-nature 's moods , no doubt . The night struck [me]0-i as full of inarticulate complaint , turbulent and distressed — a night to make [one]232-one think of [lost youth]555-lost youth , and dead loves ; and of that most inconveniently haunting of [beings]556-beings , [the still living woman whom — almost certainly — one]557-the still living woman whom — almost certainly — one ought to have married.—I often think of [her]557-the still living woman whom — almost certainly — one , for [I]0-i have a tender heart , and [she]557-the still living woman whom — almost certainly — one was really very charming.—I thought of [her]557-the still living woman whom — almost certainly — one now as [I]0-i stood on the wind - swept verandah . A long trail of scarlet , trumpet - flowered honeysuckle had torn away from its fastenings , and beat against the ironwork just above [my]0-i head . And here observe the advantages of cultivating a various mind ! In a few seconds [I]0-i was enjoying all the pensive satisfactions of self - reproach . For [I]0-i ought to have married [her]557-the still living woman whom — almost certainly — one . Unquestionably [I]0-i ought . It is true when [I]0-i proposed [she]557-the still living woman whom — almost certainly — one refused [me]0-i . But that is a detail . [I]0-i had delayed ; [I]0-i had shilly - shallied . [I]0-i had been seen in equivocal company , and [a considerate friend]558-a considerate friend had not been wanting to report that damaging incident . And then [I]0-i had been too ready to take “ No ”[560-the woman] for an answer . Decline to take “ No , ”[560-the woman] oh [[my]0-i brothers]559-my brothers , wholly decline to take it , and in the end [the woman]560-the woman will invariably say “ Yes . ”—Here[560-the woman] modesty intervened , inquiring , “ What , invariably ? ”[560-the woman] And [I]0-i replied , “ Yes , always , invariably , ”[0-i] refusing to permit officious modesty thus to put out the purifying fires of self - reproach . BUT just then a deprecating voice , worthy to be that of modesty incarnate , gently addressed me.—“Mr . [She]65-charlotte stood on [my]0-i right , between [me]0-i and the steps , and [her]65-charlotte appearance was arresting . This shawl was an exquisite thing — one of [Leversedge]58-leversedge 's many costly gifts . In colour violet , it was stiffened at the border with delicate gold and silver threads and arabesques worked in many - coloured silks . WHY is there always [a third person to whom one]585-a third person to whom one owes a duty ? And why do the claims of [that third person]586-that third person become paramount at precisely the most inconvenient moments ? “ ' Twas even thus from childhood 's hour ”[586-that third person] in [my]0-i experience . Ah ! what is it to have retained a little odd and end of a conscience ! [Charlotte Perry]65-charlotte moved down [the dusky alley]589-the dusky alley beside [me]0-i in silence . [We]590-we reached the path running along [the shore]547-the shore before [she]60-miss perry spoke . The moon had sailed out from behind the floats of cloud , and [her]60-miss perry light made a wide pale stain right across [the lake]370-the lake , in which the broken crests of the waves leapt up like tongues of silver flame . For [he]75-gerrard was short , sallow , and inclined to stoutness ; in moments of asperity [I]0-i could have found it in [my]0-i heart to call [him]75-gerrard greasy - looking . [His]75-gerrard hair was black , rather long , and of an uncomfortable thinness and smoothness . What of moustache [he]75-gerrard owned was black also . [He]75-gerrard dressed soberly , as in mourning for lost illusions . [She]62-mrs. perry looked questioningly from one to the other . “ But , [[my]62-mrs. perry dear]1689-my dear , ”[62-mrs. perry] [she]62-mrs. perry said,—“of course [you]1880-dearest mother know best , and [I]58-leversedge would n't interfere with [your]1880-dearest mother arrangements on any account , [you]1880-dearest mother know ; but is n't it rather odd — it is so awkward to say like this — but [you]1880-dearest mother know , [[my]58-leversedge dear]1689-my dear , how nervous [I]58-leversedge am at night , and if [Papa]115-papa goes to bed too [you]1880-dearest mother 'll be left alone with [these three gen]1884-these three gen — ”[58-leversedge] A quantity of loose music fell with a slither and thump from the piano on to the floor , and [Gerrard]75-gerrard stooped , murmuring excuses for [his]75-gerrard stupidity , to pick it up . [The lake]370-the lake is looking awfully pretty to - night . ”[58-leversedge] [I]0-i OBEYED [his]58-leversedge summons , and leaned beside [Leversedge]58-leversedge upon the stone balustrade of [the balcony]661-the balcony . To - night [the garden]291-the garden was very sufficiently illuminated . Earlier in the evening [the local orchestra]675-the local orchestra had discoursed music of a questionable sweetness upon [the verandah]549-the verandah ; and [the whole of [[our]678-our company]679-our company , reinforced by [a contingent from [the town]681-the town]680-a contingent from the town]677-the whole of our company , reinforced by a contingent from the town , still lingered in the balmy night air , taking little drinks around the tables upon [the terrace]546-the terrace , or strolling about [the paths and shadowy alleys]683-the paths and shadowy alleys . [A gang of children , clothed in white garments]684-a gang of children , clothed in white garments , chased each other , with cries , across the broad lawns and in and out of [the shrubberies]685-the shrubberies . Far out on [the lake]370-the lake , [someone]687-someone was singing to a thrumming banjo accompaniment . This was the first time [I]0-i had seen [Leversedge]58-leversedge , save in the presence of [witnesses]688-witnesses , for several days . [I]0-i had fancied , probably quite erroneously , that [I]0-i detected a slight unwillingness on the part of the fair [Charlotte]65-charlotte to leave [us]678-our together . [I]0-i was the more glad , therefore , to note a very distinct improvement provement in [[my]0-i companion]394-my companion 's looks and bearing . [The man]432-the man was evidently happy , and when [a man]1765-a man is happy [I]0-i hold [he]1765-a man may very safely be left to [his]1765-a man own thoughts . [Gerrard]75-gerrard had subsided into an arm - chair close to the grand piano . [He]75-gerrard was not [a large man]699-a large man , yet [he]75-gerrard had the iniquitous habit of slightly overflowing every chair in which [he]75-gerrard sat . [I]354-the girl love the half light too , ”[354-the girl] [the girl]354-the girl answered . “ It is sympathetic . Partially to conceal is to suggest , is n't it ? And to suggest is often really to reveal the deeper , the everlasting meaning , do n't [you]354-the girl think so ? ”[354-the girl] [She]354-the girl got up . “ Yes — yes — let [us]1904-us extinguish them , ”[354-the girl] [she]354-the girl said , with a sort of fervour . The dark may even prove [a friend]361-a friend ; at times [I]0-i have found it so [myself]0-i . But this was not one of those times , and somehow [I]0-i mistrusted the events of the last few minutes ; neither [Gerarrd]120-gerarrd 's action or [our]707-our fair [Charlotte]65-charlotte 's had appeared to [me]0-i quite spontaneous . [I]0-i reproved [myself]0-i for [my]0-i eternal cavilling where [these two persons]708-these two persons were concerned ; yet [I]0-i remained impressed with the feeling that [his]58-leversedge request had been curiously insistent , [her]709-her granting of it curiously elaborate . And then , [the darkened room]710-the darkened room unquestionably wore a somewhat sinister aspect , by no means calculated to dispel uncomfortable suspicions , however foolish and unfounded such suspicions might be . The electric lights on [the terrace]546-the terrace threw a vague , stark sort of brightness , crossed by equally vague bluish shadows , upon the ceiling , upon portions of the wall above the piano , and upon the edges of the furniture near the window . The shadow of the ironwork of [the balcony]661-the balcony lay along the floor , twisted and contorted by the opposing angles of the lamps below . Otherwise [the room]429-the room and [its]429-the room contents were colourless and indistinct . As [Miss Perry]60-miss perry 's fingers touched the keys again , [I]0-i placed [myself]0-i on the sofa left vacant by [[her]60-miss perry mother]359-her mother 's departure to [the connubial chamber]715-the connubial chamber . [His]119-leversedge face was turned towards [the darkened room]710-the darkened room ; but [I]0-i had a sense it bore an expression of exaltation , the exaltation of something successfully dared and won . [The man]432-the man was generous to a fault . Generosity communicates a pleasant glow to [the whole person]720-the whole person . [I]0-i have been generous [myself]0-i just often enough to know that [one]232-one 's first sensation is delicious , as is the first moment after jumping out of a cold bath . [I]0-i have , also , observed [you]722-you need subsequently to rub [yourself]722-you very hard if [you]722-you would retain either the moral or spiritual sensation of warmth . The tonic has been a trifle too strong , a reaction follows . These thoughts passed through [my]0-i mind as [I]0-i looked up at [Leversedge]119-leversedge , and in doing so became aware that [his]119-leversedge lean , well - made figure — showing black against the purple depth of the night sky — was surrounded , like the cushions and carved woodwork of the sofa immediately below [him]119-leversedge , by a pale luminous outline . [Charlotte Perry]65-charlotte played that nocturne — [I]0-i stupidly forget the number of it — with a tenderness beyond all praise . [I]0-i murmured something of [my]0-i very genuine admiration , the most rudimentary taste forbidding , to [my]0-i thinking , at all pronounced applause . [Gerrard]75-gerrard , however , uplifted [his]75-gerrard voice without hesitation . [He]75-gerrard belongs to a set — the Mrs. Septimus Mertyns set — in which endless discussion is fashionable , and a hundred and one wise reasons are offered in justification of even the most trivial personal opinion . [He]75-gerrard spoke languidly , yet loud . [He]75-gerrard intended [us]723-us to hear . “ Thanks , ”[75-gerrard] [he]75-gerrard said , “ [you]722-you have surpassed [yourself]722-you . That is what renders it so profoundly interesting . The religious emotion in its simple expression is always joyous , is n't it ? ”[75-gerrard] “ [I]354-the girl think so , ”[354-the girl] [the girl]354-the girl answered softly . “ [I]75-gerrard am sure that it is , ”[75-gerrard] [Gerrard]75-gerrard asserted . “ Recalling the hours when [I]75-gerrard have been most deeply conscious of the magnetism of the Divine Idea , [I]75-gerrard recognise that they were hours of unalloyed joyousness . ”[75-gerrard] [I]0-i hugged [myself]0-i silently at the thought of [Gerrard]75-gerrard of [all men on [earth]1693-earth]725-all men on earth , [Percy Gerrard]75-gerrard , [author of [Leda]121-leda 's Lover]727-author of leda 's lover , and [editor of the Present Day]728-editor of the present day , with [his]75-gerrard lethargic temperament and gift of heavy feeding , in a condition of unalloyed joyousness , thanks to the magnetism of the Divine Idea ! “ But here , notwithstanding the presence of true spirituality , [I]729-you find little gladness . It had the effect of a challenge as delivered by a cockerel , none too certain of [his]75-gerrard own prowess or of [his]75-gerrard footing , from the top of a wall . [His]75-gerrard manner and the subject of [his]75-gerrard discourse , in short , were quite ironically at variance . “ To [me]75-gerrard it seems [you]729-you found in that nocturne , and gave in [your]729-you rendering of it , the melancholy , not of a rejected soul — far from that — but rather of one who , after long struggle , has sacrificed the consummation of terrestrial happiness in obedience to the compelling dominion of some moral idea ; and who , looking back , momentarily gauges the immensity , [I]75-gerrard had almost said , the enormity of such a sacrifice . ”—He[75-gerrard] paused , trying , as [I]0-i imagined , to gain more mastery over [his]75-gerrard wandering voice.—“Yes , [your]729-you reading was richly subtle , richly pathetic . [I]75-gerrard too can figure that broken melody , those searching harmonies , which seem to vibrate through the secret places of one 's most innermost being , as the utterance of [some exquisite woman]1908-some exquisite woman , [artist by nature , saint through the constraining power of adverse circumstance]1909-artist by nature , saint through the constraining power of adverse circumstance , as [she]1908-some exquisite woman realises for some brief but hideous instants the eternal anguish , the glory of [her]1908-some exquisite woman own self - dedication . ”[75-gerrard] “ It 's all very fine , [I]119-leversedge daresay , ”[119-leversedge] [Leversedge]119-leversedge said ; “ but , upon [my]119-leversedge honour , if this sort of thing goes on the kicking will have to take place sooner than [I]119-leversedge expected . ”[119-leversedge] [Gerrard]75-gerrard turned towards [us]730-us , [his]75-gerrard face projecting itself as a livid platelike object from the encompassing obscurity . “ [I]75-gerrard beg [your]119-leversedge pardon , [I]75-gerrard did not quite catch what [you]119-leversedge were saying , [Mr. Leversedge]119-leversedge ; [you]119-leversedge were good enough to remark ? ”[75-gerrard] “ Oh ! [The young lady]484-the young lady 's melting mood seemed to have passed , giving place to a very different humour . What [she]484-the young lady played during the ensuing ten to fifteen minutes [I]0-i do not know . [I]0-i never heard it before ; [I]0-i am more than willing never to hear it again . [I]0-i suppose it must have been a tarantella , but a tarantella conceived in [a madhouse]733-a madhouse . It gave [me]0-i a nightmarish impression of [innumerable tormented , shrieking , human figures whirling in a desperate and formless dance]734-innumerable tormented , shrieking , human figures whirling in a desperate and formless dance — driven hither and thither in purposeless fashion , like desert sand by an evil wind . It was exciting , for it took one into [the region of utter lawlessness]735-the region of utter lawlessness ; and [that region]736-that region is always exciting , however undesirable . This was decidedly exciting , but it was not quite nice . [Miss Perry]60-miss perry lent [herself]60-miss perry whole - heartedly to the spirit of the music . [I]0-i trust [I]0-i am far from being [a prude]737-a prude , but there are limits , and [she]484-the young lady passed them . [Her]60-miss perry playing was not quite nice . Perhaps , therefore,—I have confessed to a dislike of [the man,—it]738-the man,—it stirred [Gerrard]75-gerrard 's somewhat sluggish blood . [I]0-i watched [him]738-the man,—it rise , and move slowly close to the side of the grand piano , facing [the girl]354-the girl as [she]354-the girl played — [[his]738-the man,—it squat person]740-his squat person a blot of deeper darkness against the dark . [Leversedge]119-leversedge made a movement also . [I]0-i fancied [he]119-leversedge did not relish the performance , and was going out on to [the balcony]661-the balcony to escape somewhat from it ; but [he]119-leversedge merely stepped into the middle of the window , while [his]119-leversedge shadow , crossing that of the iron balustrade , lay right along the carpet of [the room]429-the room almost to where the skirt of [Miss Perry]60-miss perry 's light dress trailed back from the music stool . The music grew in vehemence and force , in violence of discordant sounds ; while [the human figures it conjured up before [me]0-i]743-the human figures it conjured up before me seemed to become more wanton in the passion of [their]743-the human figures it conjured up before me dance . The thing was unpleasant . [I]0-i wished it would stop . It affected [me]0-i uncomfortably , it agitated [me]0-i . [I]0-i could not remain quite still . [I]0-i began fidgetting with the scalloped frills of [good Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry 's puce silk pillows , while [I]0-i meditated upon the extraordinary divergence of nature exhibited by [the mother]744-the mother and daug hter . Kindly and estimable clock - moon ! by what strange workings of heredity had [she]744-the mother contrived to produce this young creature , possessed as [she]744-the mother just now appeared to be , by the spirit of a fin de siècle Bacchante ? Just then [Leversedge]119-leversedge spoke . [He]119-leversedge was close to [me]0-i . [His]119-leversedge voice was hoarse.—“Hammond , ”[119-leversedge] [he]119-leversedge said , “ would [you]0-i mind keeping [your]0-i hand away from that cushion ? ”[119-leversedge] [I]0-i looked up at [him]119-leversedge in some surprise . [He]119-leversedge had turned sideways and the light took [his]119-leversedge profile . [His]119-leversedge face had changed notably in the last few minutes . It had grown thin , and , as once before , [his]119-leversedge lips stood away from [his]119-leversedge teeth . “ By all means , [[my]0-i dear fellow]1625-my dear fellow , ”[0-i] [I]0-i answered , “ if [you]119-leversedge wish it . But why ? Is anything the matter ? ”[0-i] “ The dog 's the matter , ”[119-leversedge] [Leversedge]119-leversedge said quietly . “ It 's sitting on that cushion . [It]1911-it 's just jumped up . ”[119-leversedge] [I]0-i glanced at the cushion and then back at [Leversedge]119-leversedge . For an instant [I]0-i doubted whether [he]119-leversedge was chaffing ; though , considering [our]745-our former discourses upon this subject , it occurred to [me]0-i as improbable [he]119-leversedge should indulge in so grim a joke at [his]119-leversedge own expense . But that one glance assured [me]0-i very completely [he]119-leversedge was very far from chaffing . [I]0-i debated inwardly what could be done — whether it was possible to demonstrate convincingly to [Leversedge]119-leversedge , once and for all , that [he]119-leversedge laboured under an hallucination . But the wicked spirit which infected [Miss Perry]60-miss perry 's playing , and expressed itself in that chaotic clamour , still agitated [me]0-i and rendered it difficult to [me]0-i to think clearly . [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i made a disastrous mistake . If [I]0-i did so , let it be put down , in part at all events , to the Witches ' Sabbath of sound assailing [my]0-i ears and plaguing [my]0-i brain , and not exclusively to [my]0-i inborn stupidity . “ Believe [me]0-i , [you]119-leversedge are dreaming , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said . “ [I]0-i give [you]119-leversedge [my]0-i word there is nothing whatever upon that cushion . ”[0-i] “ [I]119-leversedge am not lying , anyhow , ”[119-leversedge] [Leversedge]119-leversedge answered rather hastily . “ [You]0-i are behind it , so of course [you]0-i ca n't see . Come round — stand here — now look . ”[119-leversedge] So , to humour [him]119-leversedge [I]0-i got up and stood beside [him]119-leversedge , while [Charlotte Perry]65-charlotte played , still played . “ There now , ”[119-leversedge] [he]119-leversedge went on,—“now [you]0-i can see its eyes . [You]0-i must see them ; they 're plain enough , [I]119-leversedge 'm sure . And look how the silk of the cushion gives under the beast 's haunches and under its forefeet . ”[119-leversedge] And [I]0-i stared obediently,—at what ? Merely the little crumples left by the impress of [good Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry 's solid shoulders — little wandering lines of light , that appeared to [me]0-i as abundantly pathetic , abundantly absurd , taken in connection with the supernatural horror whose presence [they]746-they were declared to indicate . “ Heaven forbid [I]0-i should seem to call [your]119-leversedge veracity in question , ”[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed ; “ but , indeed , [I]0-i see nothing . [[My]0-i dear friend]1599-my dear friend , [you]0-i are [the victim of an optical or cerebral delusion]1913-the victim of an optical or cerebral delusion — [I]0-i suppose the two mean much the same thing — as [I]0-i have told [you]0-i all along . No dog , no nothing , is there , and [I]0-i can prove it to [you]0-i . ”[0-i] Certainly [Leversedge]119-leversedge never showed to better advantage than under extreme pressure . If [his]119-leversedge courtesy failed for an instant , [he]119-leversedge recovered speedily and very gracefully . Now [his]119-leversedge lips gave , and [he]119-leversedge smiled at [me]0-i in that singularly longsuffering way of [his]119-leversedge . “ [I]119-leversedge am afraid not , though [I]119-leversedge wish to goodness [you]0-i could , ”[119-leversedge] [he]119-leversedge said . “ No , no ; for mercy 's sake do n't touch it ! ”[119-leversedge] [His]119-leversedge voice dropped.—“It smells — [the brute]1620-the brute — to - night it smells — [your]0-i hands will never feel clean again . ”[119-leversedge] [I]0-i own it required a little nerve , for [I]0-i was shaken by that violent and ceaseless music , and [Leversedge]119-leversedge 's tone and manner were calculated to produce faith in the most sceptical mind ; still , [I]0-i did sweep [my]0-i hand down slowly over the surface of the cushion . And , of course , it encountered no resistance . How could it , since , as [I]0-i had affirmed , nothing , absolutely nothing , was there ? “ [You]119-leversedge see , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said . Meanwhile [Miss Perry]60-miss perry 's playing became slower , more broken , full of wailing ; as though the dance had changed to a Danse Macabre , and [Death]122-death was breaking [their]748-their ranks , bearing away or beating down [those lawless dancers]749-those lawless dancers . [Gerrard]75-gerrard moved a little nearer , [he]75-gerrard bent over and talked to [the girl]354-the girl , the occasionally shrill tones of [his]119-leversedge voice , which still appeared to be under insufficient control , mingling oddly with [her]354-the girl playing . Suddenly a cry — it was exceedingly dreadful , it turned [me]0-i cold and sick — broke in through the rhythm of the music , and [Leversedge]119-leversedge rushed past [me]0-i across [the room]429-the room . [The train of [Charlotte Perry]65-charlotte 's dress]752-the train of charlotte perry 's dress lay out pale over the floor ; and [he]119-leversedge kicked it , stamped on it , trampled [it]752-the train of charlotte perry 's dress under foot . It is among the best of the several good things of life ; but it is , [I]0-i must add , among the good things of which it is quite possible to have enough . For all that which [Miss Perry]60-miss perry had said was true — true , every word of it!—And [we]862-we had passed the stage of acquaintance when one can successfully take refuge in denial . [I]354-the girl have burnt [[my]354-the girl ships]1995-my ships , [I]354-the girl have accepted [my]354-the girl lot . Why then try to juggle with [me]354-the girl ? It is [you]354-the girl , dear [Miss Perry]60-miss perry , who beg it , while [I]0-i am trying to introduce a trifle of common sense into the consideration of it . ”[0-i] [She]354-the girl turned away , letting [her]354-the girl arms drop at [her]354-the girl sides , and stared over the bows of [the lake - boat]785-the lake - boat , now heading in towards the row of [great Lombardy poplars which line [the gay little quay]870-the gay little quay and marketplace of [Montreux]25-montreux]869-great lombardy poplars which line the gay little quay and marketplace of montreux . “ [I]354-the girl implore [you]354-the girl , in the name of reason , to leave all thought of [me]354-the girl out of the business . ”[354-the girl] For an instant [Miss Perry]60-miss perry looked at [me]0-i . “ But how can [I?”—I]60-miss perry[60-miss perry] can not actually assert that [I]0-i heard those words , but [her]354-the girl quivering lips appeared to form them . “ Granting , for the sake of argument , even , ”[354-the girl] [I]0-i went on , “ that [I]0-i have been idiot enough to think , in any degree , any one of the stupidities of which [you]354-the girl accuse [me]0-i , what does that signify as against the very real and serious matter of [your]354-the girl marriage ? [You]354-the girl are — pardon [my]0-i saying so — straining at a gnat and swallowing a camel with a vengeance . [Bear]129-bear with [me]0-i if [I]0-i speak plainly.—Marry [Constantine Leversedge]58-leversedge because [he]58-leversedge loves [you]354-the girl , if [you]354-the girl wish to do an heroic act of kindness . Really , [I]0-i believe at times [I]0-i have the right to congratulate [myself]0-i on possessing miraculous strength of character . The flower - like , the dewy , the early , early morning and exquisitely virginal effect seemed suddenly to have passed away from [Miss Perry]60-miss perry . [Her]60-miss perry throat was round , firm , the colour of it a warm , delicate brown — delicious in the sunshine , which — for [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i was shamefully neglecting [[my]0-i office of [umbrella bearer]873-umbrella bearer]872-my office of umbrella bearer — enveloped [her]60-miss perry graceful figure from head to heel . “ [You]0-i are certainly ungenerous , ”[60-miss perry] [she]60-miss perry retorted . “ But [all men]2000-all men are that , [I]60-miss perry believe , if [an unhappy woman]2001-an unhappy woman so far forgets conventionality as to obey the dictates of — No , pass that by . It is well to be loved by [one man]2032-one man . It is just doubly well to be loved by [two]2033-two . And — ”[354-the girl] [The girl]354-the girl stretched out [her]354-the girl hands .
