[Her]65-charlotte happiness is secured . It is completed instead of being wrecked . ”[0-i] These are things to turn [one]232-one 's hair grey , even contemplating them after a lapse of years . Let [me]0-i take breath ! So very much comes into this question of marriage that [one]232-one 's brain fairly reels under it . For [a woman]1776-a woman it is probably , as [Perry père]60-miss perry remarked , “ an arduous undertaking ”[60-miss perry] ; but for one of [us]882-our , oh [[my]0-i brothers]559-my brothers , it is — well , what is it not ? Personally , [I]0-i am unfitted for a primitive state of society , [I]0-i know that . Were [you]887-you to take off [my]0-i clothes and send [me]0-i up a tree to pick nuts , [I]0-i should go very hungry [myself]0-i ; while [those dependent upon [me]0-i]888-those dependent upon me would almost certainly starve . Yet [I]0-i look back , not without yearning , to the epoch of primal innocence , when [man]581-man and [woman]582-woman mated gaily , parted gaily , even as those most delectable of living creatures , the birds , do . For the bond of wedlock , as understood for many hundred years now by the more civilised nations — specially [those of [the Anglo - Saxon race]892-the anglo - saxon race]891-those of the anglo - saxon race — adds a terror to life . To pass two or three days in [the Divorce Court]893-the divorce court would be about as much to [my]0-i taste as passing them in [the Old Fleet Ditch]894-the old fleet ditch ; yet how can [a man of average sensibility]895-a man of average sensibility be expected , at a given moment , to know and make up [his]895-a man of average sensibility mind finally and irrevocably in respect of womanhood and the affections ? [Aphrodite]132-aphrodite is [a mighty and marvellous goddess]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess . Who that has once , in ever so small a degree , beheld [her]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess glory , shall dare worship [her]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess under a single aspect only , or in a single place ? Of course there is the ancient theory — does it not at least date from the days of [Aristophanes?—of]133-aristophanes?—of [the One Man]897-the one man — [the One Woman]898-the one woman ; and [I]0-i have laboured valiantly to cherish it , since it appeared to offer a practical solution to [my]0-i moral and emotional difficulties . Like [the hero of a certain evil and exquisite romance]899-the hero of a certain evil and exquisite romance , the title of which [I]0-i refrain from mentioning , [I]0-i set out early in quest of [the One Woman who should satisfy all [my]0-i aspirations , all [my]0-i tastes , all — if [you]901-you will have it — [my]0-i latent masculine sensuality ; who should dominate [me]0-i at first sight , who should hold [me]0-i then and ever after]900-the one woman who should satisfy all my aspirations , all my tastes , all — if you will have it — my latent masculine sensuality ; who should dominate me at first sight , who should hold me then and ever after . [I]0-i have sought [her]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess diligently , and — [I]0-i admit it reluctantly , for it must sound most impertinently fastidious — [I]0-i am seeking [her]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess yet . This quest , indeed , has become a fixed idea with [me]0-i . It presents itself , as a matter of course , at sight of each new and charming face — and the number of new and charming faces which offer themselves for inspection is really delightfully great . It presents itself even in respect of faces already fairly well known to [me]0-i , under circumstances of a peculiar or provocative character . It presented itself very distinctly to [me]0-i now , on [the sunny deck of [the lake - boat]785-the lake - boat]902-the sunny deck of the lake - boat , as [Miss Perry]60-miss perry 's soft voice faltered , and [she]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess stretched out [her]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess hands in that most moving action of appeal . [She]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess was so varied , so captivating , so uncommonly clever , at times so deliciously pretty ; [her]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess prospects were of so dubiously hopeful and encouraging a sort . And then , had [she]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess by chance spoken the truth , not only in respect of [my]0-i reading , but of [my]0-i misreading , of [her]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess ? Might not , by chance , [her]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess picture of [herself]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess be a more faithful one than that which [I]0-i — with [my]0-i wretched little habit of being too sharp by half in the ungracious business of picking [[my]0-i neighbours]904-my neighbours to pieces — had drawn of [her]896-a mighty and marvellous goddess ? Surely it was very generous , after all [my]0-i silent detraction and , at moments , [my]0-i outspoken disagreement , thus to give [me]0-i another chance ! And then the coercive , the well - nigh irresistible , flattery of thus finding [oneself]905-oneself the object of [a young and lovely person]906-a young and lovely person 's affection ! Is there anything on [earth]1693-earth quite so agreeable?—(For a little while , at all events . After the first blush of the affair one usually becomes inconveniently sensible of make - weights and conceivable complications)—No ! [I]0-i protest there is not . And so it came about that , for the space of at least twenty seconds , [I]0-i asked [myself]0-i quite seriously whether it was not possible that here , here in [the daughter of Perry père et mère , of the lively rat and excellent clock - moon]908-the daughter of perry père et mère , of the lively rat and excellent clock - moon , improbable as it might appear at first sight , [I]0-i had found that which [I]0-i had sought so long and vainly — the complement of [my]0-i nature , the comprehensively and perpetually seductive being , the , for [me]0-i , [One Woman]909-one woman ? Those twenty seconds were immensely pleasant , [I]0-i would willingly have extended them indefinitely . But , alas ! for that at once so consolatory and so detestable doctrine — the Doctrine of Perpetual Flux — twenty seconds were the limit ; and then the delectable equilibrium in which [my]0-i mind had hung was rudely disturbed . It went on working — [I]0-i mean that eternal see - saw , which [I]0-i call [my]0-i mind , did . [It]910-it suffered a barbarian invasion of rough doubts , tumultuous questions , inartistic moralities , which beat upon it as with heavy clubs . For , after all , when [I]0-i came to consider it , no miraculous change had passed over [Charlotte Perry]65-charlotte , or [[her]65-charlotte parents]339-her parents , or [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend [Leversedge]58-leversedge , or [myself]0-i , or [our]913-our mutual relations , or [our]913-our prospects , or [our]913-our antecedents , or [our]913-our surroundings . All these stood precisely where [they]914-they had stood . That which [we]913-our had been , both in regard of [ourselves]913-our and each other , that [we]913-our still essentially and indubitably were . There was no squaring the circle . It was all , not otherwise , but just exactly so . For how was [I]0-i , who had never yet given [myself]0-i away , of [all men]2000-all men to give [myself]0-i away thus recklessly ? Bless [my]0-i soul , contemplate the inevitable consequences ! How was [I]0-i , who had always plumed [myself]0-i on maintaining a nice standard of taste in friendship , of all [men]1622-men to steal [his]1622-men fiancée , and play the part of [a Bowdlerised King David]917-a bowdlerised king david to [the Uriah of poor dear [Leversedge]58-leversedge]918-the uriah of poor dear leversedge ? No , no ; it was really a trifle tiresome , but , in truth , [I]0-i had neither moral courage nor was [I]0-i scoundrel enough for all this . And then , with a blush of shame [I]0-i remember it , for it reflects small credit on either [my]0-i head or heart , one of those trivial incidents occurred which so completely and immediately quench the fires of [my]0-i not perhaps very strikingly volcanic nature . [Miss Perry]60-miss perry , [I]0-i apprehend , had found these twenty seconds longer than [I]0-i did . [She]60-miss perry became restless ; [she]60-miss perry grew — it was very excusable — somewhat impatient of [my]0-i silence . The grey deck planks , where the hem of [her]60-miss perry brown holland skirt touched them , were strewn with the remnants of [her]60-miss perry bouquet of buttercups . [She]60-miss perry put out [her]60-miss perry right foot , and in a nervous , and — [I]0-i am compelled to add — somewhat awkward , manner pushed the green stems aside and crushed the shining petals . [Those women who are possessed of well - shaped feet]919-those women who are possessed of well - shaped feet , kindly permit [one]232-one , in the present day , to be fully aware of that agreeable fact ; and it occurred to [me]0-i that , considering [her]60-miss perry pretensions to fashion , the opportunities afforded [me]0-i of beholding the fair [Charlotte]65-charlotte 's feet had been distinctly limited . Now [I]0-i understood why . Whether Nature or [her]60-miss perry bootmaker was in fault , [I]0-i can not , of course , pretend to determine . [I]0-i charitably trust [the former]921-the former . For with Nature clearly there is no arguing ; whereas [any human being , possessed of the powers of speech and volition]922-any human being , possessed of the powers of speech and volition , can remonstrate with and , in extreme cases , change [their]922-any human being , possessed of the powers of speech and volition bootmaker . [Miss Perry]60-miss perry 's boots or shoes — [I]0-i think they were shoes — were wide , easy , trodden over , their square toes turned badly heavenward . [I]0-i could write a pamphlet on the subject of boots — they are an awful revelation of personal character . Vulgarities otherwise skilfully concealed come out in the shape of a heel ; sloth leaves indelible tracks across upper leathers . In moments of illumination [I]0-i have detected gluttony in a lace and profligacy in a button . [The Carissima]83-the carissima 's shoes did not betray the presence of any mortal sin , let [me]0-i hasten to add . But since , judging by the rest of [her]83-the carissima costume , [I]0-i could be in no doubt as to the sufficiency of [her]83-the carissima purse , they disclosed a vein of indolence , of insufficient pride , of lack of perception ; they were the shoes of one whose promise is better than [her]83-the carissima performance , of [one capable of alarming lapses]923-one capable of alarming lapses — briefly , [they]924-they did n't do . And in the theory of [the One Woman]898-the one woman it is imperatively necessary that the whole should please in detail , as well as in its completeness . And — what a relief ( yes ! [I]0-i had reached that stage already ! ) to be able to pack the manifold pros and cons into the compass of a syllogism — here was a detail which radically displeased , therefore [Miss Perry]60-miss perry was not [the One Woman]898-the one woman . It was undoubtedly soothing to have the matter thus definitely settled ; but it was anything but a graceful pastime to convey the assurance of that settlement to [[my]0-i companion]394-my companion . Is it conceivable that [women]299-women really enjoy refusing [[their]299-women admirers]929-their admirers ? If so , [they]299-women are amazingly strong - minded , judging by [my]0-i own — but [I]0-i abstain from further comment . Suffice it to say , [I]0-i am conscious that a certain ardour which must have been perceptible in [my]0-i attitude and manner — though [I]0-i am not endowed with a superfluity of what is technically known as “ facial expression”—flickered[60-miss perry] and died . And [Miss Perry]60-miss perry — [I]0-i was unspeakably ashamed , yet how , oh ! how [I]0-i blessed [her]60-miss perry — must have been aware of that waning of a fine flame . “ Please give [me]60-miss perry [my]60-miss perry parasol , [Mr. Hammond]57-mr. hammond , ”[60-miss perry] [she]60-miss perry said , suddenly , hastily . “ The sun is very hot . ”[60-miss perry] [She]60-miss perry sat down , drooped down , upon the camp stool again . [I]0-i was horribly afraid [she]60-miss perry was crying , as [I]0-i handed [her]60-miss perry [her]60-miss perry umbrella — but [I]0-i am not sure . [I]0-i avoided looking at [her]60-miss perry . [I]0-i really had not the face to do so , for [I]0-i knew [I]0-i must appear utterly despicable to [her]60-miss perry . [I]0-i appeared so to [myself]0-i . In spirit [I]0-i poured forth volumes of scathing invectives against [myself]0-i , vials of contemptuous wrath upon [my]0-i own devoted head . [I]0-i found it in [my]0-i heart to wish [the lake - boat]785-the lake - boat might incontinently strike upon a rock and founder , and that [I]0-i might magnanimously sacrifice [my]0-i life — [I]0-i am [a singularly poor swimmer]931-a singularly poor swimmer — in saving that of [Miss Perry]60-miss perry . This was a cheap wish , since [I]0-i was aware [the Lake of Geneva]26-the lake of geneva is deep beyond all possibility of shipwreck from the above cause . During these twenty seconds — and more , for the silence lasted — [I]0-i certainly paid a heavy price for those other twenty seconds of delightful mental equilibrium . To speak was of necessity to apologise ; and to apologise was little short of an insult . [I]0-i might have gone away ; but to go away seemed to [me]0-i a course of action at once uncourteous and inconclusive . So , in rich discomfort , [I]0-i waited . The bell had rung , [we]932-we were steaming westward once more , while [Montreux]25-montreux and [its]25-montreux poplars receded in the distance . “ The civil marriage will take place on Thursday , at [Geneva]2-geneva , ”[65-charlotte] [Charlotte Perry]65-charlotte said , at last . “ [Constantine]58-leversedge has gone [there]1793-there to - day to see [the Consul]2035-the consul and make all necessary arrangements . [He]58-leversedge has been resident in [the district]2036-the district for a sufficient length of time , there will be no difficulty or — or delay . The religious ceremony will take place here on Friday . ”[65-charlotte] [The girl]354-the girl looked up . [Our]932-we eyes met . “ [You]0-i will be present ? ”[354-the girl] [she]354-the girl added softly . “ Unfortunately [I]0-i can not be , ”[0-i] [I]0-i replied . “ [I]354-the girl leave by the mail to - night . [I]354-the girl shall be in [Paris]27-paris , on [my]354-the girl way to [England]9-england . ”[354-the girl] “ No , no ! ”[60-miss perry] [Miss Perry]60-miss perry cried . [She]354-the girl rose to [her]354-the girl feet and faced [me]0-i imperiously . [Her]354-the girl tearful mood had wholly vanished . [She]354-the girl became that which [she]354-the girl had been the night before , almost alarming , almost tremendous , notwithstanding [her]354-the girl youth and remarkable good looks . “ [You]0-i shall not escape so easily , ”[354-the girl] [she]354-the girl said . “ [I]354-the girl have borne much from [you]0-i , but [I]354-the girl refuse to bear that . [You]0-i shall not slip away comfortably and amuse [yourself]0-i — perhaps with [some other friend]2037-some other friend — [friend?”—her[354-the girl] voice]2038-friend?”—her voice took a most disconcerting inflection of sarcasm—“elsewhere , while [you]0-i leave [me]354-the girl to lift the great burden which [you]0-i — yes , [you]0-i — have helped to force upon [me]354-the girl , unaided and alone . [I]354-the girl have a claim on [you]0-i — [we]2039-we need not discuss the exact nature of it , since [you]0-i , [I]354-the girl think , hardly dare deny its existence — and [I]354-the girl require [you]0-i to meet that claim to the full . This is not revenge , this is justice — bare justice . [You]0-i shall be witness of this business to the very end . [You]0-i shall see what [I]354-the girl do , hear what [I]354-the girl say — [I]354-the girl will leave [you]0-i no loophole for disbelief , for doubt . [You]0-i shall recognise [my]354-the girl worth — [you]0-i shall admire [my]354-the girl conduct — [I]354-the girl will compel [you]0-i to admire it . ”[354-the girl] Suddenly [Charlotte Perry]65-charlotte 's eyes filled and [her]65-charlotte mouth gathered into that really delicious suggestion of a kiss . [I]0-i was carried away in spite of [myself]0-i . “ [I]0-i admire [you]65-charlotte already , ”[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed . “ [You]65-charlotte are extraordinary , [you]65-charlotte are enchanting . ”[0-i] Again , for a moment , [the girl]354-the girl 's appearance grew absolutely dazzling . “ Ah ! ”[65-charlotte] [she]65-charlotte cried , “ [I]65-charlotte have wrung that out of [you]0-i at last — no , pray say no more . Do not spoil [your]0-i admission either by exaggeration or by explanation . Leave it as it stands . Submit to be spontaneous for once ! ”[65-charlotte] — [Her]65-charlotte tone changed , became pensive , modest , full of hesitation . “ [You]0-i will remain , [Mr. Hammond]57-mr. hammond , and take part in the — the sad — for [some of [us]2041-us]2040-some of us it must be sad — ceremony of Friday . This is Tuesday , so after all the time is short — [you]0-i will help [me]65-charlotte to prevent [[my]65-charlotte poor dear parents]1997-my poor dear parents arriving at any premature knowledge of the truth . While listening to [their]941-their artless , though wordy conversation , [I]0-i bowed low before the genius of [Charlotte Perry]65-charlotte . [I]0-i could not fathom [her]60-miss perry , [she]60-miss perry was beyond [me]0-i ; consequently — for masculine vanity recoils instinctively from [the feminine creature]942-the feminine creature it has not the wit to fathom — [she]60-miss perry was not , and never could be for [me]0-i , [the One Woman]898-the one woman . Yet [she]60-miss perry was , [I]0-i owned it , [a woman of ten thousand]944-a woman of ten thousand , for [she]60-miss perry could play a losing game , [she]60-miss perry could show [herself]60-miss perry great in the hour of defeat . IT is really rather annoying to find how , having once , though for the most perfectly legitimate object , started a disturbing line of thought , that line of thought refuses to quit [you]945-you , finds perpetual occasion for reproducing itself ; hunts [you]945-you , in short , as though it had started [you]945-you instead of [your]945-you starting it . For instance , [I]0-i had been very thoroughly into the question of [the One Man]897-the one man and [the One Woman]898-the one woman on the lake - boat that afternoon . It would have appeared that , having so satisfactorily closed the question , [I]0-i ought also to have disposed of it , and have been — for a time , at all events — delivered from its hauntings . But it was not so , it was not so . [I]0-i might have closed the question , but very certainly [I]0-i had failed to dispose of it . [I]0-i had relieved [my]0-i feelings in a sonnet to an imaginary Uniquely Fair One , in the small hours of the night . Yet , notwithstanding this drastic remedy — the metrical difficulties of sonnet - construction [I]0-i find extremely reducing to an enkindled imagination , no wonder this particular form of poetic outcry has been dear to [the distracted lover of all ages]948-the distracted lover of all ages — [I]0-i discovered next morning that , in truth , the question still retained the very strongest disposition to dispose , if not of [me]0-i , still of [my]0-i time and thought . [I]0-i loitered on [the verandah]549-the verandah after breakfast . The morning was positively divine , the air having just that hint of an edge to it which agreeably convinced [you]945-you , notwithstanding the heat haze dancing over the brilliant landscape , that [glaciers and snow - fields]950-glaciers and snow - fields were after all within easy reach . And that edge to the air , far from soothing a slightly heated fancy , is liable to produce des éblouissements and provoke a feverish restlessness . Across [the startlingly green lawn]951-the startlingly green lawn , just below , [the lithe young Russian lady of the scarlet silk blouse and black pigtail]952-the lithe young russian lady of the scarlet silk blouse and black pigtail wandered bare - headed . [She]952-the lithe young russian lady of the scarlet silk blouse and black pigtail was innocently employed in picking ox - eyed daisies and clover heads from among the grass ; and as [she]952-the lithe young russian lady of the scarlet silk blouse and black pigtail plucked them [she]952-the lithe young russian lady of the scarlet silk blouse and black pigtail indulged in snatches of song — sad with the sorrow of long northern winters , as it seemed to [me]0-i , and the endless monotony of [the Steppe]28-the steppe . [I]0-i do not attempt to trace out the association of ideas . It may have been a revolt against the melancholy of the folk - song ; it may have been an effect of colour — vivid scarlet against vivid green , the strong note of black — heaven forgive [me]0-i if [I]0-i begin to talk like [an art critic!—in skirt]953-an art critic!—in skirt and hair , affecting [my]0-i brain as a dram might ; it may have been a certain fierceness in the action of the fine - made , angular figure , stooping and pulling at the flowers — [I]0-i ca n't pretend to say . Suffice it that [my]0-i soul was invaded by a crazy longing to live , to give [myself]0-i away , to be dangerous . [I]0-i went back upon the position of yesterday ; and it was borne in upon [me]0-i — it has often been so before — that [I]0-i am but [a paltry creature , the decadent product of a decadent age]954-a paltry creature , the decadent product of a decadent age . [I]0-i know so well what to avoid , [I]0-i know so very ill what to do . [I]0-i fell to envying Leversedge [his]955-his diabolic dog ; [Charlotte Perry]65-charlotte the courage of [her]65-charlotte perversions — that perhaps is the best way of stating it ; even [Perry]60-miss perry père [his]955-his enthusiasm for the Primrose League and rich enjoyment of the enunciation of platitudes ; even [Percy Gerrard]75-gerrard [his]75-gerrard inherent grossness . Oh ! to be positive for once , instead of tentative merely , or negative ! When [candid persons]956-candid persons tell [me]0-i so , [I]0-i wish , of course , to beat [them]956-candid persons ; but , in the privacy of that evil quarter of an hour , [I]0-i accused [myself]0-i of being thin ; and [Myself]0-i answered that in truth [I]0-i was , morally emotionally , and in respect of all action , thin , very lamentably thin indeed . And just when [I]0-i was touching the lowest deep of this unpleasant , but , no doubt , salutary depth of self - abasement , when [I]0-i was becoming literally flattened out by the heavy weight of [my]0-i own inadequacies , enter unto [me]0-i [Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry . [Failing other female acquaintances]958-failing other female acquaintances , of well - accredited position , [good Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry took [me]0-i . For a moment the Eternal Masculine in [me]0-i — for the Eternal Masculine does exist just as actually as the Eternal Feminine , though it happens at the present time not to have so fashionable a notoriety as [the latter]529-the latter — arose in revolt . [I]0-i was almost willing to regard [myself]0-i as nothing better than an example of infructuous and hoary spinsterhood . “ [You]0-i have always taken such a kind interest in [[our]2051-our dear young people]2052-our dear young people , ”[62-mrs. perry] [she]62-mrs. perry continued , “ that [I]62-mrs. perry know [you]0-i will be pleased to hear everything is so comfortably settled . ”[62-mrs. perry] [She]62-mrs. perry confronted [me]0-i bridling , [her]62-mrs. perry worthy moon - face suffused with smiles . [Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry 's matutinal appearance invariably suggested the thought that [she]62-mrs. perry was wearing out [her]62-mrs. perry last year 's Sunday gown . The present example of that economical habit was green ; enriched by steel and bugle ornaments , notably in the region of the waist , where they took the form of strings of pendants bearing an affinity to Papuan full dress . [Her]62-mrs. perry grey hair , smoothly banded on the brow , was greenish in hue from the too lavish application of some adhesive unguent . It was , moreover , surmounted by a lace and ribbon cap , in form and colour curiously resembling a poached egg . What remained to [her]62-mrs. perry of [her]62-mrs. perry eyebrow , raised to a permanently surprised height , pushed [her]62-mrs. perry forehead up into innumerable horizontal lines . [I]0-i found it impossible to dislike [Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry , [she]62-mrs. perry was too perfectly simple and genuine a being . [He]84-mr. perry is so very tenacious about [[her]65-charlotte friends]524-her friends being satisfied . ”[973-i] After all , what is truth that [we]974-we should be so desperately anxious to speak it ? Absolute truth became unattainable , in all probability , many thousand centuries ago . Very distantly approximate truth is the utmost [we]974-we can hope to arrive at in [our]974-we present state of lamentable over - development , when the mist of unnumbered opinions has obscured every conceivable question of human conduct and of human relation . Is not the mere attempt to speak it , perhaps , a refined form of spiritual pride and self - seeking ? Better , [I]0-i think , rub a little emollient ointment of passing peace upon the soul of [the brother or sister who happens to be nearest [you]976-you]975-the brother or sister who happens to be nearest you , by endeavouring to take whatever view of things — not actually criminal — [you]976-you perceive will yield [them]977-they solace , however fleeting . It was uncommonly warm under the plane - trees . [He]1055-his was absolutely still — a modern St. Simeon Stylites upon [[his]1055-his lonely pillar]1057-his lonely pillar — victim , even as this last was , allowing for the difference of outlook brought about by the lapse of fifteen centuries , of the strange torments of a fixed idea . [I]58-leversedge was so absurdly tired,—that little bit of business with [the Consul]2035-the consul yesterday regularly knocked [me]58-leversedge up — [I]58-leversedge do n't know what [I]58-leversedge am coming to,—but [I]58-leversedge had n't the energy to get up and move about , so [I]58-leversedge lay still and let it lie . And it chilled [me]58-leversedge clean through . ”[58-leversedge] Not [[my]0-i worst enemy]1071-my worst enemy has ever accused [me]0-i of an intemperate passion for physical exercise ; but there are times when one must do violence even to one 's highest virtues . “ Come and drink , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , “ and then come and walk . Even a salamander might find some of [the vineyard paths on [the hillside]2234-the hillside]2233-the vineyard paths on the hillside agreeably sultry . [You]2235-you may get warm there in time — heaven knows , [I]0-i shall get so soon enough . [We]2236-we can but try . ”[0-i] Under the plane - trees the lusty infant , backing away from [its]1072-its own spadeful of pebbles , came into violent collision with [[my]0-i companion]394-my companion 's long legs . Involuntarily it assumed a sitting position with , to itself , unexpected rapidity and force . [Leversedge]58-leversedge stooped down and picked up [the baby]1074-the baby , which , by no means disconcerted by its sudden elevation , continued to send forth prehistoric cries of unalloyed cheerfulness . “ [You]1074-the baby 're [a nice , promising little chap]2237-a nice , promising little chap , ”[58-leversedge] [Leversedge]58-leversedge remarked . Yet , after all , was it jocund ? [I]0-i asked [myself]0-i this question many times as [we]1098-we set forth , [a self - conscious and ill - assorted little band]1099-a self - conscious and ill - assorted little band , upon the morning of that particularly grilling September day . Have [you]1123-you ever happened to drive a tender - hearted stray sheep and a loitering lamb ? [I]0-i never have ; yet after [my]0-i experience with [Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry [I]0-i seem to possess a quite professional knowledge of such driving . [Two]2033-two might attain where one had failed . In the doorway [Mrs. Mertyns]70-mrs. mertyns met [us]1129-us . Forgive [me]0-i if [I]0-i fall into the style of contemporary fiction — for truly [Mrs. Mertyns]70-mrs. mertyns is nothing if not contemporary — and describe [her]70-mrs. mertyns as a long , diaphanous dream of [a woman]1776-a woman , clothed in slightly faded mauve and white . [Her]70-mrs. mertyns head was crowned by a large white chip hat , embowered in shaded mauve carnations , and smothered in a vast white net veil tied in a bow high at the back . [Her]70-mrs. mertyns rather thin throat was surrounded by several rows of very good pearls . [I]0-i understand that pearls , like germinating seeds or hatching chickens , need a tender and steady warmth to bring them to perfection . To secure this , [Mrs. Mertyns]70-mrs. mertyns invariably wore [her]70-mrs. mertyns pearls . [My]0-i imagination fails to picture [her]70-mrs. mertyns without them . As of course [you]1137-you know , [her]70-mrs. mertyns looks , in certain circles , have afforded a perennial subject of controversy . [Some persons]1138-some persons assert that [she]70-mrs. mertyns is washed out , sandy , [her]70-mrs. mertyns features meaningless , [her]70-mrs. mertyns figure quite uncomfortably attenuated , [her]70-mrs. mertyns arms of a length and leanness almost distressing . [They]1138-some persons amiably add , as a rule , that [she]70-mrs. mertyns is unpardonably self - conscious both in speech and bearing ; while other , and no doubt more enlightened , [critics]241-critics find in each of the above peculiarities an added note of beauty . Not the robust flesh - and - blood beauty , well understood , which [the mistaken Greek]1140-the mistaken greek loved to sculpture or [the mistaken Venetian to paint]1141-the mistaken venetian to paint ; but a beauty altogether refined and spiritual — a joy to the imagination rather than the eye , a sentiment rather than a sight , a flavour rather than a feeling , a face and form , in short , redolent of infinite suggestion . [These critics]1142-these critics usually wind up [their]1142-these critics discourse with a reference to [Septimus Q.C.]154-septimus q.c. , and murmur—“But , how could she?”—in[154-septimus q.c.] faltering voices . For [my]0-i own part , [I]0-i have always held [Mrs. Mertyns]70-mrs. mertyns to be [a very clever person]1143-a very clever person ; clever to the point of possessing all the effect of [a pretty woman]1144-a pretty woman , while being , in point of fact , [a plain one]1145-a plain one . This is among the very highest of social arts . [The successful professor of it]1146-the successful professor of it commands [my]0-i applause . The more so , probably , that [[our]1147-our own well - beloved country - women]1148-our own well - beloved country - women are somewhat incapable in the exercise of it . [They]1148-our own well - beloved country - women need to be really quite pretty before [they]1148-our own well - beloved country - women know how to appear so . Such conduct is weakly realistic . Neither [[their]1148-our own well - beloved country - women French nor American sisters]1149-their french nor american sisters are much handicapped by such obviously false modesties . [Mrs. Mertyns]70-mrs. mertyns , standing just inside [the railway carriage]1150-the railway carriage , took good flustered [Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry 's thick warm hand tenderly in [her]70-mrs. mertyns long thin one . “ [I]70-mrs. mertyns am so truly glad [you]62-mrs. perry are the first to come , ”[70-mrs. mertyns] [she]70-mrs. mertyns said , with gentle haste , “ because if [you]62-mrs. perry object , or if [you]62-mrs. perry think [darling Charlotte]65-charlotte would object , [you]62-mrs. perry can tell [me]70-mrs. mertyns so at once — [we]2261-we are [old enough friends]2262-old enough friends , [dear Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry , to dare to be truthful , are [we]2261-we not?—and [I]70-mrs. mertyns will disappear immediately . ”[70-mrs. mertyns] [She]70-mrs. mertyns crossed [her]70-mrs. mertyns left hand over [her]70-mrs. mertyns right , and , with raised elbow and drooping wrist , took [my]0-i left hand and held it . “ Ah ! so [you]62-mrs. perry are admitted , ”[70-mrs. mertyns] [she]70-mrs. mertyns added brightly . “ That is delightful . [I]1152-i felt [I]1152-i really must come . And yet [I]1152-i was diffident . [We]2270-we discussed the question yesterday evening all through dinner . [I]1152-i think all [[my]1152-i people]2271-my people would have liked to come . But [I]1152-i could not allow that . And so [I]1152-i said [I]1152-i would just slip away quietly with [[my]1152-i husband]1989-my husband . [We]2270-we would take a little [Darby]156-darby and [Joan]157-joan day 's holiday . [Charlotte]65-charlotte looked exceedingly pretty , standing there framed by the dark lines of the doorway . [She]1152-i wore a biscuit - coloured dress with very large pink sleeves to it ; and a hat to match , garlanded with pink roses , the broad brim of which , turning up , formed a pale straw - coloured nimbus about [her]1152-i head . [The girl]354-the girl 's mouth gathered , quivered ; [her]1152-i eyes were adorably dewy . And so it happened that [we]1166-we journeyed towards [Geneva]2-geneva , sitting opposite to [each other]527-each other , rather cut off from the rest of [the company]1168-the company . It was extremely hot , and [we]1166-we had to pull down the canvas blinds and half close the windows to keep out sun and dust . [The train]1122-the train roared along ; the vineyards reeling past on one hand , the rocks , white with fluttering mouettes and lapped by clear little green waves , on the other . It need hardly be stated that [the two athletic Englishwomen]1170-the two athletic englishwomen had left all windows down and blinds up in [[their]1170-the two athletic englishwomen compartment]1171-their compartment , thus supplying [us]1166-we with a liberal measure of glare , cinders , and engine smoke . Above the noise of [the train]1122-the train , from time to time , [I]0-i heard [Mrs. Mertyns]70-mrs. mertyns ' somewhat senseless and soulless laugh . Like [many women in society]1173-many women in society , [she]70-mrs. mertyns had a tendency to laugh , not in proportion as [she]70-mrs. mertyns was amused , but in proportion as [she]70-mrs. mertyns was bored . [A better man]2304-a better man than [I]119-leversedge , under all the circumstances , would have talked less and done something practical . [Old Perry]158-old perry 's income , such as it is , pretty well dies with [him]119-leversedge . And [she]158-old perry ought to have money , [she]158-old perry can use it — it is necessary to [a woman]1776-a woman with [her]158-old perry gifts , and it is miserable to think of [her]158-old perry wanting it , now or any when . The conversation could not continue at that level of emotion ; and [one]232-one always has a sense of bathos in struggling towards the surface after such a plunge into the deep sea of feeling . [Women]299-women hold hands , and kiss each other , and cry a little , on the way up to the surface , which must be a great help . But to [us]1176-us , to [whom these tender modifications of the situation are denied , the ascent]1177-whom these tender modifications of the situation are denied , the ascent is extremely embarrassing . [The girl]354-the girl 's pretty eyes had been reproachful whenever [they]1210-they chanced to meet [mine]0-i during that deadly day . [They]1210-they were reproachful still . Suddenly [the girl]354-the girl stopped [me]0-i . “ [You]0-i go too far , ”[354-the girl] [she]354-the girl said , “ for [I]354-the girl can not believe [you]0-i are utterly heartless , and so [you]0-i must be aware , in a measure , of all [I]354-the girl am feeling.—Oh ! [I]354-the girl know [you]0-i are talking well — [you]0-i usually do that . But , just now , that [you]0-i should be agreeable is of very slight moment to [me]354-the girl . ”[354-the girl] [She]354-the girl raised [her]354-the girl hand and pointed to the dark high - shouldered cathedral . “ [You]0-i remember [they]2315-they burnt [people up there]2316-people up there , once upon a time , ”[354-the girl] [she]354-the girl said . “ Well , [I]354-the girl feel towards [your]0-i talk much as [those people]2317-those people must have felt towards the grasshoppers — listen to [them]2317-those people now — singing gaily in the sunshine while the flames leapt up that — ”[354-the girl] “ No , no , no , pardon [me]0-i , ”[0-i] [I]0-i cried . “ It is [you]354-the girl who go very much too far . Forgive [my]0-i remarking that [your]354-the girl illustration is a wild exaggeration , altogether beyond the facts of the case . ”[0-i] “ [You]354-the girl know what [I]354-the girl have done , [you]354-the girl know why [I]354-the girl have done it , and [you]354-the girl make agreeable conversation . Does not [your]354-the girl sense of justice compel [you]354-the girl to own [my]354-the girl sincerity at last ? ”[354-the girl] “ Oh , quarrel with [me]0-i as much as [you]354-the girl like , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said . “ That is healthy enough . But do n't lose sight of the proportion of things , and indulge in distorted comparisons . It is unworthy of [your]354-the girl intelligence to do so , to go thus madly beyond the facts of the case . ”[0-i] [The girl]354-the girl clasped [her]354-the girl hands and moved a couple of steps aside , with one of those swift movements which would look so excellently upon the stage . “ But can anything really go beyond the facts of the case ? ”[354-the girl] [she]354-the girl asked in tones of sharp , thin distress . Upon [my]0-i word , [I]0-i was very much provoked with [the Carissima]83-the carissima , provoked to the point of being greatly minded to tell [her]354-the girl , once and for all , that [she]354-the girl was [a goose]1217-a goose . “ Yes , most emphatically many things can , ”[0-i] [I]0-i answered . “ Does [a man]1765-a man 's love carry so little weight with [you]354-the girl that [you]354-the girl dare speak as though to be the sole and supreme object of it was a dire misfortune ? Moreover , [Leversedge]119-leversedge comes to [you]354-the girl with [his]119-leversedge hands by no means empty . [She]354-the girl regarded [me]0-i with some amazement . But that is not the main point ; the main point is [your]354-the girl very limited appreciation of the affection of [the man [you]354-the girl are marrying]2324-the man you are marrying . ”[0-i] “ Are [you]0-i aware that [you]0-i are simply scolding [me]394-my companion ? ”[394-my companion] [[my]0-i companion]394-my companion inquired sweetly . “ Yes , [I]0-i am perfectly well aware of it , [[my]0-i dear young lady]1706-my dear young lady , ”[0-i] [I]0-i replied genially . “ And unless [you]1706-my dear young lady actually run away from [me]0-i , or call for help , [I]0-i am fully prepared to continue the process . [She]65-charlotte closed [her]65-charlotte charming eyes , and raised [her]65-charlotte hand as though to ward off a blow . But the vision of [Leversedge]119-leversedge was upon [me]0-i ; [Leversedge]119-leversedge in [that basting railway carriage]1220-that basting railway carriage , and the broken passion of [his]119-leversedge utterance . [I]0-i would not relent . “ Bear with [me]0-i while [I]0-i point out to [you]1706-my dear young lady that those dreams are but pale and ghostly fictions , beside the real , the very full - blooded , romance of [Leversedge]119-leversedge 's affection . Do n't [you]1706-my dear young lady understand , [you]1706-my dear young lady are the last word of poetry , of art , of religion — even — to [him]119-leversedge . And is that nothing ? [I]0-i am not often thus loudly didactic . To be so is to be crude , and [I]0-i shudder at crudity . Even now [I]0-i dared not pause long , lest a quite opposite side of the case should present itself to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i should begin to fear not only that [my]0-i enthusiasm was slightly ridiculous , but that [I]0-i might , after all , be presenting [[my]0-i hearer]1221-my hearer with a garbled edition . Garbled or not , it appeared to work upon [her]1221-my hearer . [She]1221-my hearer stood silent ; and [her]1221-my hearer pretty face , set in the aureole of [her]1221-my hearer wide - brimmed , rose - garlanded hat , wore a questioning expression somewhat — so [I]0-i flattered [myself]0-i — new to it . And this encouraged [me]0-i . [I]0-i held a brief for [Leversedge]119-leversedge — well , then , [I]0-i would strike while the iron was hot , [I]0-i would go on , [I]0-i would plead [his]119-leversedge cause yet further . “ [[My]83-the carissima dear young lady]1706-my dear young lady , [you]1706-my dear young lady have been bewitched by much talk , by much reading , by all manner of ingenious hair - splittings regarding the emotions , regarding the relation of [men]1622-men and [women]299-women . [You]1706-my dear young lady have just married [a man who adores [you]1706-my dear young lady , to whom [you]1706-my dear young lady — briefly — represent rapture]2330-a man who adores you , to whom you — briefly — represent rapture ; well , lend [yourself]1706-my dear young lady a little to the situation . [The rooms]1248-the rooms were really crowded . [We]1233-we were nothing , indeed , if not gay that evening . On [our]1233-we return from [Geneva]2-geneva , [I]0-i had dined with [Leversedge]171-leversedge and [the Perry family]651-the perry family in [the restaurant]1250-the restaurant . Dined ? rather say feasted ! And [Perry]65-charlotte père had been horribly profuse in anecdote ; but [I]0-i capped [his]1251-his vilest quotations , [I]0-i applauded [his]1251-his stalest stories . For [the Carissima]83-the carissima was gentle , natural , wholly captivating ; while [Leversedge]171-leversedge held [himself]171-leversedge gallantly , and had a light in [his]1251-his eyes good to see . And these things produced in [me]0-i an amiability little short of divine . [I]0-i so very seldom am overtaken with charitable activities in respect of [[my]0-i fellow - men]1252-my fellow - men , [I]0-i so seldom do anything — in the least burdensome to [myself]0-i — to promote [their]1252-my fellow - men welfare , that [I]0-i was really quite overcome by [my]0-i own successful altruism . If , thanks to [me]0-i — for had [I]0-i not , overruling the distaste of [the one]329-the one , and scruples of the other , pushed [these two]1254-these two into [each other]527-each other 's arms , thus finally and irrevocably?—if , [I]0-i say , the half marriage went so merrily , might not the whole marriage go to perfection ? For the time [I]0-i enjoyed all the proud pleasures of [the preacher]1256-the preacher , [the evangelist]1257-the evangelist , [the director]1258-the director . [I]0-i comprehended the fascinations of the sacerdotal position . [I]0-i had “ played with [souls ”]2360-souls ”[0-i] for [their]1252-my fellow - men good , temporal and eternal ; and had won [them]1252-my fellow - men , though the odds against such winning were extremely heavy . [I]0-i had saved [Leversedge]171-leversedge 's reason , probably [his]1259-his life into the bargain . [I]0-i had converted [the Carissima]83-the carissima . And , for the time , [I]0-i own it , [my]0-i conceit of [myself]0-i was colossal — rampantly , gloriously blatant . It was in this spirit of profound self - congratulation that [I]0-i beheld [Leversedge]171-leversedge and [[his]1259-his bride]224-his bride pass out into the dusky brightness of [the garden]291-the garden , and that [I]0-i conducted [Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry to a gilded chair in [the salon]531-the salon , whence [she]62-mrs. perry could witness the humours of the dance ; while [Mr. Perry]84-mr. perry [, full of dinner , hilarity , and parental pride]1263-, full of dinner , hilarity , and parental pride , instituted [himself]84-mr. perry [Leader of [the Revels]1265-the revels]1264-leader of the revels , encouraging [the musicians]1266-the musicians , and inducing the wildest confusion by introducing [young ladies]2076-young ladies , of whose names and nationalities [he]84-mr. perry was quite uncertain , to [gentlemen]1268-gentlemen , whom [he]84-mr. perry did not in the very least know . Then the sweet influences of accomplished duty pervaded [me]0-i — a large , digestive calm , subtly mingled with the blissful serenity of one upon whose undertakings [the gods]1837-the gods have smiled , so that [he]84-mr. perry finds [himself]84-mr. perry both [a better and abler man than [he]84-mr. perry had ever imagined [himself]84-mr. perry to be]1270-a better and abler man than he had ever imagined himself to be . [I]0-i retired into [the hall]302-the hall , to a secluded corner behind [one of the groups of pillars supporting the first - floor gallery]1272-one of the groups of pillars supporting the first - floor gallery . There [I]0-i sat and smoked , and thought — as [I]0-i invariably do think when [I]0-i am feeling very good — of [the white rectory house]1273-the white rectory house away in [slumberous Midlandshire]49-slumberous midlandshire , of [the old ecclesiastical historian]1274-the old ecclesiastical historian ( [his]1274-the old ecclesiastical historian living interest in things long dead , [his]1274-the old ecclesiastical historian deadly indifference regarding things still living ) , and of [the woman [I]0-i ought to have married]604-the woman i ought to have married , [the only woman]1276-the only woman , as [I]0-i firmly believe ( when [I]0-i am feeling very good ) , that [I]0-i ever really loved , [the woman [I]0-i never make the slightest effort to see]1277-the woman i never make the slightest effort to see — sweet [Lydia Castern.—And]175-lydia castern.—and meanwhile [I]0-i watched [the passing crowd]1278-the passing crowd , and , since the double doors of [the salon]531-the salon , facing [me]0-i , stood wide open , caught passing glimpses of [the dancers]1280-the dancers , [my]0-i senses pleasantly dulled by the sound of many footsteps , many voices , the rustle of [women]299-women 's garments , across all which , advantageously tempered by distance , came the strains of [the band]1236-the band . Surely [I]0-i might take [my]0-i ease . Was not everything going to admiration ? Out there , under the stars , amid the magic of the fair September night , was not [Constantine Leversedge]58-leversedge making love , [his]58-leversedge soul delivered from the grotesque and ghastly dream of the diabolic dog ? And was not [Charlotte]65-charlotte , [née Perry]65-charlotte , listening , [her]65-charlotte soul delivered from dreams hardly less grotesque and ghastly — from false standards of taste , of fashion , from false refinements , false intellectualities , from a silly pursuit of decadent eccentricities ? Was [she]65-charlotte not beginning to comprehend what an exquisite , yet very simple solution — notwithstanding the prurient purities of [contemporary feminine novelists]1283-contemporary feminine novelists and [reformers]1284-reformers — true - love offers to the much - vexed question of the sexes ? Beginning to comprehend how deep - rooted and terrible , yet how exceedingly pretty a pastime , is the love of [an honest man]1285-an honest man — and [many men]1286-many men are honest , after all , [you]1287-you know — for [an honest woman]1288-an honest woman ? [My]0-i soul expanded under these charming meditations . For was [I]0-i not [the deus ex machina]1289-the deus ex machina , was not this good work mainly of [my]0-i making ? Had [I]0-i yielded to [the Carissima]83-the carissima 's thoughtless coquetries , and involved [myself]0-i in any intimate relation to [her]83-the carissima , how different the result ! It was the cut of [her]83-the carissima shoes that saved [me]0-i ? Perish the thought!—it was [my]0-i own high - mindedness , [my]0-i own self - forgetting appreciation of the justice of the situation . Had [I]0-i counselled [Leversedge]58-leversedge weakly to withdraw , instead of bravely to remain , again how different the result ! [I]0-i beheld the vision of two wasted lives . [The Carissima]83-the carissima , moreover , let loose upon [society]1290-society , possibly to entangle [me]0-i — yes , [me]0-i , after all , in the end . Instead of which , here [I]0-i sat , replete with the perfect peace of conscious impeccability . Verily , how delightful are the leisures of [the righteous]1291-the righteous , how inspiring the repose of [him]1291-the righteous who seeks the advantage of [others]1721-others rather than advantage of [his]1291-the righteous own ! Five minutes more , and [I]0-i might have added a hundred and fifty - first to the hundred and fifty Psalms of [King David]176-king david , with a difference — a difference possibly somewhat in the direction of [M. Tartufe]177-m. tartufe . But [I]0-i was saved from any such disaster by the sound of a low grunt . As [I]0-i have already stated , [I]0-i am — [I]0-i thankfully affirm — acquainted with but [one human being who testifies to the fact of [his]1293-one human being who testifies to the fact of his presence in this primitive manner presence in this primitive manner]1293-one human being who testifies to the fact of his presence in this primitive manner . It is a little introductory habit of [Mr. Percy Gerrard]75-gerrard ; and [he]75-gerrard often employs it as a preface to observations the reverse of agreeable — so [I]0-i fancy , but then [I]0-i own to a prejudice against [Percy Gerrard]75-gerrard . On the present occasion [he]75-gerrard had “ stolen upon [me]75-gerrard softly ”[75-gerrard] ; and [his]75-gerrard manner struck [me]0-i as less intolerably superior than usual . [He]75-gerrard really seemed to wish to make [himself]75-gerrard agreeable . “ ' Evening , [Hammond]57-mr. hammond , ”[75-gerrard] [he]75-gerrard murmured affably , as [he]75-gerrard dropped into a neighbouring chair . “ Dancing ? How superfluous ! [You]57-mr. hammond are very right to remain out here . [The modern bourgeois ballroom]2361-the modern bourgeois ballroom — and this , [I]75-gerrard imagine , is pre - eminently bourgeois — is a revolting spectacle . Few sights , indeed , can be more repulsive than a herd of both sexes , underbred and perspiring , clasping [each other]527-each other 's waists , and revolving , with prolonged and boisterous fatuity , in time to some wholly imbecile tune such as offends [my]75-gerrard ear at the present moment . ”[75-gerrard] Nevertheless , [Gerrard]75-gerrard pushed [his]75-gerrard chair farther to the left , with the evident desire to gain a clearer view of the festivities going forward in [the salon]531-the salon . But [a good many persons]1295-a good many persons stood about the doorway , and it was only at intervals that [one]232-one obtained full sight of [the dancers]1280-the dancers . “ An exhibition of untamed animality ! ”[75-gerrard] [he]75-gerrard murmured mured in tones of disgust . “ [I]75-gerrard hold it proof of the skin - deep quality of [our]2363-our vaunted civilisation that performances of this description are countenanced , nay , encouraged — it is humiliating to think of — by [really very decently educated people]2364-really very decently educated people . ”[75-gerrard] “ From the Perfectly Ordered State , then , dancing is excluded ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i inquired . For [I]0-i was still at peace with [all mankind]1298-all mankind , and even [Gerrard]75-gerrard 's unlovely humours failed to ruffle [me]0-i . [I]0-i even played up to [him]75-gerrard , indulged [him]75-gerrard . In the columns of [The Present Day]1299-the present day [he]75-gerrard had lately been sketching [Arcadias]50-arcadias and Utopias according to [his]75-gerrard graceful fancy . [He]75-gerrard was not slow to observe the allusion , and turned to [me]0-i with a gleam of gratified vanity in [his]75-gerrard dull eyes . “ Ah ! [you]0-i read those little things of [mine]75-gerrard ! ”[75-gerrard] [he]75-gerrard said . “ They had merit — [I]75-gerrard knew it . ”[75-gerrard] “ Of course [you]0-i knew it . It is the most abject of exploded fictions that [a man]1765-a man can write a masterpiece without knowing it . ”[75-gerrard] [He]75-gerrard directed [his]75-gerrard slow glance upon [the crowd round the door of [the salon]531-the salon]1300-the crowd round the door of the salon again . “ Yes ; [I]75-gerrard agree with [you]0-i . [I]75-gerrard knew those articles had merit , and [the best critics]2366-the best critics confirmed [my]75-gerrard judgment . [I]75-gerrard have been asked to reprint them . ”[75-gerrard] “ Do so , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said . “ [The world]1659-the world will be the gainer . ”[0-i] [Gerrard]75-gerrard gathered [himself]75-gerrard up in [his]75-gerrard chair — planting [his]75-gerrard small square feet on the top rung of it — into a sort of spiderlike blob . What [an immensely displeasing creature]1302-an immensely displeasing creature [he]75-gerrard was ! “ Yes , [I]75-gerrard think [I]75-gerrard shall reprint them , ”[75-gerrard] [he]75-gerrard said . “ That is the worst of journalism — really beautiful things are too often lost , forgotten along with the day that gave them birth . But , since [you]0-i are interested in [my]75-gerrard visions , in the Perfectly Ordered State , which , as [I]75-gerrard devoutly trust , is equivalent to saying , in the Coming Civilisation , [woman]582-woman will resume [her]582-woman natural position , that from which the moral and intellectual barbarism of the last few centuries has ousted [her]582-woman with such deplorable results . In the Coming Civilisation there will be a very hard - and - fast line drawn between [the public]2369-the public and the private life . For [we]2370-we have ceased most lamentably to appreciate the decencies of the high wall , the heavy curtain , the locked door . The Democratic Spirit , rightly understood , is disgustingly immodest . [It]2371-it has done its best to murder secrecy and concealment , which are necessary elements in all really exquisite living . ”[75-gerrard] [The crowd]1303-the crowd opened to give passage to [the American prima - donna]1304-the american prima - donna , [[her]1304-the american prima - donna well - preserved mother]1305-her well - preserved mother , and [her]1305-her well - preserved mother stout poodle ; and , for the moment , the glistening floor of [the ballroom]1306-the ballroom and [its racing couples]1307-its racing couples were disclosed to observation . “ And so [I]75-gerrard take it , ”[75-gerrard] [Gerrard]75-gerrard continued , “ in the Perfect State , [woman]582-woman will again dance with all the grace of richly developed suggestion — behind closed doors — for the delectation of [man]581-man , who will sit still and just watch [her]582-woman , lending [her]582-woman the emotional support of a profoundly sympathetic admiration , not the brutally material one of an encircling arm . ”[75-gerrard] “ The coming civilisation has a little Oriental turn to it then ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i remarked . “ How should it be otherwise ? ”[75-gerrard] [he]75-gerrard replied . “ In many matters [the Oriental]2374-the oriental has always continued true to the light that was in [him]75-gerrard . [His]75-gerrard mind has remained unconfused by those weak notions of abstract justice , which war against the life of sense and of society . ”[75-gerrard] [Gerrard]75-gerrard drew [his]75-gerrard hand over [his]75-gerrard moist , uncomfortably smooth hair . [I]0-i may add that it partially concealed [his]75-gerrard ears . Why does [one]232-one instinctively distrust [a man whose ears are partially concealed by]1309-a man whose ears are partially concealed by [his]75-gerrard hair ? “ The pendulum has swung far enough now , in all conscience , in the western ‘ Hail [Columbia]51-columbia ! ’ direction ; with unalloyed gladness [I]75-gerrard hail indications of the return , the eastern beat.—And that reminds [me]75-gerrard — talking of dancing , of course [you]2375-you know that most exquisite place , [Palewell Friars]52-palewell friars ? [I]75-gerrard was down there at [Whitsuntide]53-whitsuntide this year . [They]52-palewell friars like to have [me]75-gerrard . [You]2375-you remember the view from [the cedar drawing - room]2376-the cedar drawing - room ? [That delightful Italian garden]2377-that delightful italian garden and [the river flowing just below]2378-the river flowing just below [it]2377-that delightful italian garden , [the lime avenues]2379-the lime avenues , and the broken ground in [the deer - park studded with the old Spanish chestnuts]2380-the deer - park studded with the old spanish chestnuts , composes as entirely a lovely home scene as — ”[75-gerrard] [He]75-gerrard stopped . Again [the crowd]1303-the crowd had broken up about the door , disclosing a view of [the ballroom]1306-the ballroom . “ A civil marriage is perfectly valid , perfectly sound in law ? ”[75-gerrard] [Gerrard]75-gerrard asked , with curious abruptness , [his]75-gerrard voice cracking up queerly at the end of the sentence . “ Unquestionably , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said . “ Precisely — of course , ”[75-gerrard] [he]75-gerrard spread [himself]75-gerrard in [his]75-gerrard chair.—“I know [most of [[our]2382-our fine English country houses]2383-our fine english country houses]2381-most of our fine english country houses , from the inside , [I]75-gerrard am happy to say . But [Palewell]178-palewell always strikes [me]75-gerrard as unique , nothing jars , nothing obtrudes itself . Its charm is a solicitation , not a demand ; while there is the inimitable flavour of an intensely aristocratic atmosphere pervading the whole scene , the whole life . ”[75-gerrard] “ Which exactly suits [you]75-gerrard ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i suggested . [Gerrard]75-gerrard turned [his]75-gerrard head , and [I]0-i perceived a singularly insolent gleam in [his]75-gerrard eyes . “ It does , ”[75-gerrard] [he]75-gerrard replied ; “ [you]0-i are perfectly right , it certainly does . [I]75-gerrard draw breath there with the emotion of perfect and natural well - being , with which , as [I]75-gerrard conceive , the Blest draw breath in the translucent air of [Paradise]54-paradise — [I]75-gerrard am at [home]281-home . ”[75-gerrard] [He]75-gerrard paused and sighed . “ [We]2382-our all have intimations , at times , of that which is utterly in harmony with the best of [our]2382-our own being — a delicious satisfaction of both the religious and artistic instincts . [I]75-gerrard had attended mass one morning in [that little gem of [a chapel]2386-a chapel]2385-that little gem of a chapel ; and later , in [the richly toned and shadowed cedar drawing - room]2387-the richly toned and shadowed cedar drawing - room , while the sunlight yet caressed the grey stone mullions of that range of vast windows , [Lady Clare]179-lady clare danced to us.—You know [her]179-lady clare ? Petite but svelte , sherry - coloured eyes and hair , with a dark pencilling of eyelash and eyebrow . A skin like cream — yet that illustration hardly gratifies [me]75-gerrard . It is a little disgustingly suggestive of the cow , and [the farm - girl]2388-the farm - girl , and a rude first - hand relation to nature . ”[75-gerrard] [Gerrard]75-gerrard lounged sideways in [his]75-gerrard chair , and flattened down [his]75-gerrard hair again . “ Think , therefore , [I]75-gerrard beseech [you]0-i , only of cream in some delectable golden jug of Renaissance workmanship , about the delicately turned body of which fauns and naïads toy amorously , in a wonder of subtly interlacing lines . Yes , [I]75-gerrard think that fairly renders the immediate sentiment of [her]179-lady clare appearance . It was all very beautiful . [The magnificent room]2389-the magnificent room , [the high - bred woman]2390-the high - bred woman , [her]179-lady clare bare neck and arms braving the sunlight , on which those historic rubies — [you]0-i know them?—glowed and shone as [she]179-lady clare passed from the voluptuous monotony of the Nautch to [the frank gaminerie of [the Café Chantant]2392-the café chantant]2391-the frank gaminerie of the café chantant . ”[75-gerrard] “ Innocent alike of the intention of either ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i remarked . “ [I]75-gerrard really ca n't tell , ”[75-gerrard] [he]75-gerrard said , with an effort at candour . “ But [I]75-gerrard hope so ; of course [I]75-gerrard hope so , for it would go far to carry out [my]75-gerrard cherished theory of woman.—And there were contrasts in the setting of the scene which , emotionally speaking , were wonderfully helpful . [The other women present]2393-the other women present wore shirts and sailor hats , [the men]401-the men were in breeches and dirty shooting - boots . Pour comble de bonheur [little Freddy Hellard]180-little freddy hellard lighted cigarettes , and [no one]440-no one chid [him]180-little freddy hellard . Ah , [I]75-gerrard shall long remember that morning , it was big with — ”[75-gerrard] [Gerrard]75-gerrard rose to [his]75-gerrard feet , peering in the direction of [the ballroom]1306-the ballroom . Again [the crowd]1303-the crowd had opened , drifting to right and left , while [Leversedge]58-leversedge and [the Carissima]272-the carissima were revealed standing in the doorway . Evidently [they]1315-they had been valsing . [The girl]354-the girl 's abundant hair was slightly disordered ; [she]354-the girl carried the train of [her]354-the girl soft peach - bloom coloured muslin dress over [her]354-the girl arm . [Leversedge]58-leversedge faced [her]354-the girl . [He]58-leversedge was laughing a little , fanning [her]354-the girl , talking to [her]354-the girl . Things went well , then ? Verily , they went most exceedingly well . [I]0-i thanked [the gods]1837-the gods . [I]0-i approved [my]0-i own conduct in this business afresh . Yet [I]0-i almost regretted to see [these lovers in the commonplace hurley - burley of a ball]1318-these lovers in the commonplace hurley - burley of a ball . [I]0-i could not find it in [my]0-i heart to think it the very best taste in [the world]1659-the world that [they]1315-they should thus appear so conspicuously in public . Moreover , [I]0-i wished earnestly to believe [them]1315-they in that state of mind in which solitude , and the repetition of certain sweet nothings , are so adorably full of high illumination , high delight . That [they]1315-they should tolerate the close contact of [their]1315-they fellow - creatures , that [they]1315-they should have any desire for activity , disappointed [me]0-i . Or , might [I]0-i trust this pointed to the light - heartedness that comes of complete happiness , the exuberant gaiety which is born of fulness of content ? There is a stage of mental as well as physical well - being which , in all living things , expresses itself in playfulness , skittishness , a disposition , as [you]1320-you may say frankly , to jump about . Could it be — but oh , dear [me]0-i , for that were indeed a notable conversion!—that [Charlotte]65-charlotte , [née Perry]65-charlotte , had reached the stage of innocent rapture in which [all young and wholesome creatures]1321-all young and wholesome creatures develop this disposition to jump about ? Yet the peace of the — to [themselves]1315-they , unexpectedly — virtuous being still upon [me]0-i , [I]0-i was disposed to press a point in the direction of cheerfulness ; to endure all things , in the shape of that most unsavoury animal , [Gerrard]75-gerrard ; to hope all things for the salvation of [Leversedge]58-leversedge 's mind ; to believe all things , concerning its purification from fashionable frivolities , of [the Carissima]83-the carissima 's spirit . And as to a questionableness of taste in thus appearing in public , well , after all , what is Taste ? The hedge from behind which the feeble shoot at the strong ; the refuge of the unproductive ; the cloak under which [the unsuccessful]1322-the unsuccessful try to cover the blackness of [their]1322-the unsuccessful envy ; the spangles with which talent tries so to dazzle the eyes of [the commonplace multitude]1323-the commonplace multitude , that it shall fail to see the stars of true genius shining on quietly very far above its head . [My]0-i metaphors might be confused , but [my]0-i determination of conviction was great . [Constantine]58-leversedge and [Charlotte]65-charlotte were right to dance , it meant everything most promising that [they]1315-they should dance . Taste?—who in the moment of honest gladness , or honest misery , ever stops to think about taste ? Thus did [I]0-i reason with [myself]0-i , while [Gerrard]75-gerrard paused beside [me]0-i , curiously spiderlike . [I]0-i quite thought [he]75-gerrard intended advancing upon [the couple in the doorway]1324-the couple in the doorway . But [the crowd]1303-the crowd , to [my]0-i relief , speedily closed up again , and [he]75-gerrard sank back into [his]75-gerrard chair with a grunt . “ [Poor girl]2396-poor girl , ”[75-gerrard] [he]75-gerrard murmured , “ [I]75-gerrard have a regard for [her]2396-poor girl . It is painful . [She]2396-poor girl was worthy of a better fate than the embraces of that — . But let [us]2397-us turn to something pleasanter , [Hammond]57-mr. hammond . [I]75-gerrard felt very thankful during that scene at [Palewell]178-palewell ; for [I]75-gerrard recognised that [my]75-gerrard prayers had been answered , and that [I]75-gerrard had not misread the signs of the times . [I]75-gerrard recognised that the reaction has set in , in very truth ; that the degrading fiction of the equality of the sexes is already exploded ; that education , doing its worst , has still failed to do any abiding injury , since [the fin de siècle woman]2398-the fin de siècle woman , true in instinct , though false in idea , mistakes the badge of [her]2398-the fin de siècle woman servitude for the brevet of [her]2398-the fin de siècle woman emancipation , and , to prove the completeness of [her]2398-the fin de siècle woman liberty , dances , like [any slave - girl of the harem]2399-any slave - girl of the harem , for the entertainment of [[her]2398-the fin de siècle woman hereditary masters]2400-her hereditary masters . [A cynic]2401-a cynic might sneer at this , as a last and crowning example of the illogic of the feminine mind . [I]75-gerrard can not sneer . To [me]75-gerrard the matter is solemnly glad from the bigness of its promise . ‘ [Woman]582-woman never civilises,’—thank [God]87-god for that . ”[75-gerrard] [I]0-i loathed [Gerrard]75-gerrard . But what was the good of relieving [my]0-i feelings by being rude to [him]75-gerrard , and telling [him]75-gerrard so ? [I]0-i had a growing conviction that [he]75-gerrard was here for a set purpose , that [he]75-gerrard harboured designs of some sort against the peace of mind of [Leversedge]58-leversedge and [the Carissima]83-the carissima . If [I]0-i was rude to [him]75-gerrard , [he]75-gerrard would go away and carry out [his]75-gerrard purpose — perhaps — all the sooner . Let [them]1326-them dance — let [them]1326-them dance ; meanwhile [I]0-i would , greatly enduring , continue the conversation . “ How about the suffrage , then , ”[0-i] [I]0-i asked , as one greedy of information , “ to which , as [a good Conservative]2403-a good conservative , [your]75-gerrard organ — that is the technical term , [I]0-i believe — [your]75-gerrard organ , has devoted so many eloquent pages ? ”[0-i] “ Assuredly , [Hammond]57-mr. hammond , [you]0-i are not taken in by [that little blague]2404-that little blague ? ”[75-gerrard] [he]75-gerrard said , turning [his]75-gerrard head slowly and looking at [me]0-i . “ [We]2405-we need it for the protection of [our]2405-we own property , of course , menaced as it is by the rapacity of [the masses]2406-the masses . [Not one woman in a million]2407-not one woman in a million is public - spirited — [the vast majority]2408-the vast majority have a savage rage for [their]2408-the vast majority own little possessions . [We]2405-we give it as the rope , the enough of rope , which will enable these dear foolish female creatures very effectually to hang [themselves]2408-the vast majority . Do n't [you]75-gerrard see ? ”[75-gerrard] “ Most emphatically [I]0-i do see , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said . Something in [my]0-i tone , [I]0-i suppose , conveyed to [[my]0-i hearer]1221-my hearer that [I]0-i had had about enough . Ah ! how stupid is it ever to lose [one]232-one 's temper , even in a good cause ! [Gerrard]75-gerrard grunted , again rose to [his]75-gerrard feet . That is all [I]75-gerrard wanted to know . ”[75-gerrard] And [he]75-gerrard pushed [his]75-gerrard way through [the crowd]1303-the crowd into [the brilliantly - lighted salon]1335-the brilliantly - lighted salon . IT was the misfortune of [Percy Gerrard]75-gerrard that [he]75-gerrard had dirty fingers , and smirched everything [he]75-gerrard touched . Those dirty fingers of [his]75-gerrard had broken up the fulness of [my]0-i self - complacency ; [I]0-i began to misdoubt the efficacy of the gospel which [I]0-i had so lately preached with such success . [My]0-i mental atmosphere changed , and for the worse ; [my]0-i whole outlook was affected . [The hall]302-the hall , for instance , which had only been pleasantly warm half an hour ago , grew stuffy . [The crowd]1303-the crowd , which had been amusing , grew oppressive . [A watering - place]1345-a watering - place or [hotel population]1346-hotel population always contains [figures of this sort]1347-figures of this sort . [Women of uncertain nationality , in strange garments , whose purses are light , whose eyes are hungry for social or any other sort of recognition , and whose day , such as it may have been]1348-women of uncertain nationality , in strange garments , whose purses are light , whose eyes are hungry for social or any other sort of recognition , and whose day , such as it may have been , is very clearly over . [Men of more than middle age]1349-men of more than middle age , who once no doubt held distinguished positions in [distant lands]1350-distant lands ; but who now grumble away a purposeless existence on a pension or annuity , play a fractious game of whist , and air imaginary grievances of gigantic proportions . Within the last half - hour these melancholy figures seemed to have multiplied exceedingly in [the hall of the Grand Hôtel]1351-the hall of the grand hôtel . And [[their]1342-people who from their general appearance suggested the idea that they had retired from active service — whether of business or pleasure — and were just “ stopping over , ” without much either of name or local habitation , making out the time till the cemetery should claim them and the very little they still were near neighbourhood]1352-their near neighbourhood was depressing . For is it not more or less thus that [we]1353-we all , [every one of [us]1353-we]1354-every one of us , end , alas ! Platitudes regarding the brevity of things gay and pleasant , the certainty of the ultimate arrival of things altogether the reverse , began to form themselves on [my]0-i lips . [I]0-i recognised that [I]0-i needed change of air , and that speedily . Just within the great door of [the portico]1096-the portico [I]0-i paused . The night was clear and sweet . In the basin of the little dribbling fountain , frogs were croaking — not the sonorous , full - throated chant of the southern frogs , but a modest tinkling note as of tiny bells . Great bats were hawking over the shrubberies in [the dim garden]1356-the dim garden . The stars were very large and keen . While from [the wine - shop of [some hamlet]1358-some hamlet , far up among [the vineyards]1359-the vineyards]1357-the wine - shop of some hamlet , far up among the vineyards , came the sound of a rude chorus of [men]1622-men 's voices and the thumping of a drum . [I]84-mr. perry look for many friendly faces to be gathered at the church door , [I]84-mr. perry 'm sure , quite a number of friendly faces.—But now to supper . ”[84-mr. perry] In speaking , [Mr. Perry]84-mr. perry waved [us]1412-us towards a table , by one of the large magnolias , at the farther side of [the terrace]546-the terrace . The rough zinc top of the table , [I]0-i remember , caught the light , as did the white balustrade parallel to which [it]1414-it stood , over which pink climbing roses , set in the flower - border below , had thrown long trails of leaf and blossom . [She]83-the carissima went quickly across [the wide gravel terrace]1416-the wide gravel terrace , and dropped into a chair at the head of the table . It appeared to [me]0-i [the young lady]484-the young lady 's whole manner and bearing was curiously concentrated ; it held no hint of hesitancy now , or of deprecating mildness . [She]484-the young lady swept by , indeed , with a certain violence ; and , as [I]0-i followed with [Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry , the effect of [her]484-the young lady struck [me]0-i as really impressive — [her]484-the young lady head and bare throat , [her]484-the young lady slim figure to the waist , in its pale draperies , standing out in profile , clean cut , from the multitudinous background of glossy magnolia leaves . And , thereupon , a suspicion overtook [me]0-i , that , even now , for good or evil , [I]0-i had not come to the end of [Charlotte née Perry]65-charlotte . [I]0-i took [my]0-i place at the little table in a spirit of expectation ; a rather weariful sense upon [me]0-i — really this day was an unconscionably long one!—that , in respect of drama , there might even now be a considerable amount ahead . As for the rest of [the party]276-the party — [Mr. Perry]84-mr. perry had skirmished off in search of supper ; [Percy Gerrard]75-gerrard still lingered , wrapped in august abstraction , under [the verandah]549-the verandah ; while [Leversedge]58-leversedge , passing round , perched [himself]58-leversedge on the balustrade near [[his]58-leversedge bride]224-his bride — [his]58-leversedge back towards the dimness of [the garden]291-the garden , [his]58-leversedge face towards the illuminated façade of [the great hotel]1422-the great hotel . [He]58-leversedge bent down and spoke in a low voice to [the girl]354-the girl . [Mrs. Perry]62-mrs. perry sat next [me]0-i , and proceeded to engage [my]0-i attention by artless discourse . [She]62-mrs. perry was gorgeously attired this evening in a rich silk gown of sanguine hue . Moreover , [I]0-i distinctly recall [her]62-mrs. perry cap . It was of [the usual respectable upper - housemaid order]1424-the usual respectable upper - housemaid order , so much affected by [elderly ladies of [our]1426-our modest nation]1425-elderly ladies of our modest nation ; but , as sign of full dress , curious little golden acorns depended from the lower lace frill of it , as wind - bells from the roofs of [a pagoda]1427-a pagoda . The feeling returned upon [me]0-i which had oppressed [me]0-i earlier in the evening , as [I]0-i worked [my]0-i way out of [the crowded hall]1435-the crowded hall , namely , that there was an abnormal , a malign element in [my]0-i surroundings . It was absurd , of course , yet increasingly the Spirit of Fear — fear of [I]0-i know not quite what — whether a perception of something supernatural , or merely a heightened perception of the ever - present possibility of tragedy in mortal existence , seemed to haunt the whispering trees and dusky garden , to diffuse itself through the blue - purple abyss of [the lake and mountains]1436-the lake and mountains , and the clear , impassive , starlit night . For [he]119-leversedge was master of [himself]119-leversedge , perfectly self - restrained , and calm — with the bitter self - restraint , the cruel calm , of one whose feet are set in the Valley of Tribulation , journeying through which [a man]1765-a man 's spirit is too deeply laden for [him]1765-a man to strive or cry , but who moves forward , with the stoicism which , in strong and simple natures , utter desolation is — thank heaven — almost sure to give . “ This is not the end , ”[119-leversedge] [he]119-leversedge said,—“not quite the end,—and with the end the rest of [you]75-gerrard have nothing to do . And now [Perry]60-miss perry père et mère followed [him]226-her father quite meekly — [she]65-charlotte weeping in a broken - spirited manner piteous to hear . “ [I]65-charlotte do n't understand , ”[65-charlotte] [she]65-charlotte said , “ and [I]65-charlotte was just growing so fond of [Constantine]58-leversedge , too . SO [we]1482-we three were left alone . To form one of [that trinity]1483-that trinity was not an honour , very certainly , which [I]0-i coveted . But there was no way to avoid it ; so , inwardly protesting , and feeling , [I]0-i confess , ignominiously nervous , [I]0-i remained . [Leversedge]58-leversedge came on along the side of the table , and dropped into the chair which [I]0-i , in the moment of the catastrophe , had vacated . [The girl]354-the girl did not look at [him]58-leversedge ; [she]354-the girl continued in the same rigid attitude , [her]354-the girl arms still flung out across the table amid the wreck of the supper ; [her]354-the girl fingers doubling and undoubling convulsively — the only sign [she]354-the girl gave of [her]354-the girl agitation . And [Leversedge]58-leversedge laid [his]58-leversedge hand on [her]354-the girl bare arm just below the elbow . It was rather ghastly to think how [her]354-the girl muscles working like that , right under [his]58-leversedge fingers , must have affected [him]58-leversedge . For a little space [he]58-leversedge sat silent , trying to force back a rising tide of very vital emotion — while , [I]0-i remember , the coffee from an overturned cup dripped slowly , slowly from the farther edge of the table on to the gravel below . At last [he]58-leversedge said — “ [[My]58-leversedge sweet]1915-my sweet , this is bad — very bad . This is the one thing [I]58-leversedge have implored might n't happen ; that [I]58-leversedge have prayed against — by day when [I]58-leversedge was free , by night when [I]58-leversedge was cursed . [I]58-leversedge have fought against the terror of its happening as one fights for life itself . [I]58-leversedge could not think it could be allowed to be — [I]58-leversedge trusted [God]87-god — whatever [God]87-god is — to be more just than that . ”[58-leversedge] [His]58-leversedge voice broke . Again [he]58-leversedge was silent , trying to recover [himself]58-leversedge . “ As for that brute [Gerrard]75-gerrard , ”[58-leversedge] [he]58-leversedge went on presently , “ [I]58-leversedge believe , as [I]58-leversedge told [him]75-gerrard , that [he]75-gerrard lied . But [you]354-the girl — [you]354-the girl — [you]354-the girl , ”[58-leversedge] cried [Leversedge,—“you]195-leversedge,—“you could n't lie . ”[58-leversedge] [He]58-leversedge bent [his]58-leversedge head and kissed the hollow of [the girl]354-the girl 's arm again and again . All this was indescribably painful ; and [I]0-i most genuinely detest what is painful — at close quarters . [I]0-i wanted to go away , [I]0-i wanted desperately to go away . But [the Carissima]83-the carissima raised [her]83-the carissima eyes to [mine]0-i . [Her]83-the carissima pretty face was still set and fierce ; but , as far as [I]0-i could judge in the dim light , it was fierce with alarm now , rather than with resolve . [Her]83-the carissima eyes entreated [me]0-i , commanded [me]0-i not to desert [her]83-the carissima .
