It became almost unbearable . If [she]83-the carissima would only give some sign ! But [she]83-the carissima continued absolutely impassive , save for the doubling and undoubling of [her]83-the carissima fingers as they rested on the table . “ [You]354-the girl see — it 's a vile thing to remind [you]354-the girl of like this — but [we]2517-we are married . [You]354-the girl may never see it again , it may never come back . Only be merciful , and try , just try . Give [me]58-leversedge a week , a month , just a little while , in which to be happy . Just in the very moment of success [I]354-the girl break down — ”[354-the girl] [She]354-the girl rose to [her]354-the girl feet , speaking violently , passionately ately , pelting [me]0-i with words , as [she]354-the girl might have with stones . “ No , [I]354-the girl do n't care what [I]354-the girl admit . Yes , [you]58-leversedge are right , [you]58-leversedge have been right all along . [I]354-the girl am [a fraud]2531-a fraud . But [I]354-the girl hoped against hope . But [you]58-leversedge were relentless ; [you]58-leversedge forced [me]354-the girl back on [myself]354-the girl ; [you]58-leversedge dragged aside the veil with which [I]354-the girl tried to conceal [my]354-the girl nothingness . Then [I]354-the girl turned to [someone else]2025-someone else . Ah ! [I]354-the girl am grateful to [you]58-leversedge — in very truth [we]2534-we have all cause to be grateful to [you]58-leversedge . ”[354-the girl] [Leversedge]58-leversedge was standing up too . [He]58-leversedge looked utterly amazed and bewildered . More than once [he]58-leversedge had tried to stay the torrent of [her]1488-her speech , unsuccessfully ; but , to [my]0-i immense relief , [I]0-i perceived that [he]58-leversedge was far too much absorbed in [his]58-leversedge own side of the drama to comprehend the purport of [the girl]354-the girl 's words . [He]58-leversedge supposed — [poor dear [Leversedge]58-leversedge]1490-poor dear leversedge — it was the terror of the diabolic dog which had thus unhinged [her]1488-her mind ; and [he]58-leversedge , of course , was responsible for that also ! “ [Charlotte]65-charlotte , [[my]58-leversedge poor child]2535-my poor child , [[my]58-leversedge poor darling]2536-my poor darling , ”[58-leversedge] [he]58-leversedge implored , “ do n't go on like this , pray do n't . Then languor and tenderness alike passed away from [him]58-leversedge . [He]58-leversedge drew [himself]58-leversedge up , and it struck [me]0-i what [a big man]1491-a big man — notwithstanding [his]58-leversedge spare make — [Leversedge]58-leversedge was . “ Is n't it a trifle late to think of that ? ”[58-leversedge] [he]58-leversedge asked [her]1488-her very quietly . There was a silence , while a dog yelped and whimpered again , close to [us]1492-us , down among the roses below the balustrade . “ [I]354-the girl do not love [you]58-leversedge , ”[354-the girl] [the girl]354-the girl said . [Leversedge]58-leversedge looked at [her]354-the girl and laughed harshly , and for an instant the devil of desire leapt into [his]58-leversedge eyes . “ That is rather unfortunate , ”[58-leversedge] [he]58-leversedge replied , “ for [I]58-leversedge love [you]1488-her — very much . ”[58-leversedge] [I]0-i turned away . Really [they]1494-they must settle the matter [themselves]1494-they . The presence of [a third person]1495-a third person had ceased to be admissible . Then [Charlotte née Perry]65-charlotte , [that unheroic daughter of unheroic parents]1497-that unheroic daughter of unheroic parents , played [her]65-charlotte last card . [I]65-charlotte lied to [you]57-mr. hammond — do [you]57-mr. hammond hear me?—I lied . ”[65-charlotte] Then [she]65-charlotte slipped round the end of the table — while the rose spray , catching [her]65-charlotte dress , rent the muslin and tore at the silk of it with a sort of lingering shriek ; and a small whitish dog , a mangy , half - starved , quivering little wretch , [his]1498-his tail between [his]1498-his legs , and a dirty tag of rope round [his]1498-his neck , crawled out from between the pillars of the balustrade , and ran , limping and yapping , behind [her]65-charlotte , across [the terrace]546-the terrace , as [she]65-charlotte fled up the marble steps into [the vast hotel]1500-the vast hotel . SOME ten minutes later [Leversedge]58-leversedge got up from beside the little table . [He]58-leversedge had made no outcry . [He]58-leversedge was quiet , desolatingly quiet , almost apathetic ; and [he]58-leversedge was shaking all over , shaking , so that instinctively [I]0-i put out [my]0-i hand to support [him]58-leversedge . “ Thanks , ”[58-leversedge] [he]58-leversedge said . “ There 's nothing that [I]58-leversedge know of to wait for now . Perhaps [we]2539-we may as well go in , [Hammond]57-mr. hammond ; do n't [you]57-mr. hammond think so ? ”[58-leversedge] But on the threshold of the glass door of [the salon]531-the salon [he]58-leversedge paused , shaking too violently to go farther . [The ballroom]1306-the ballroom was dark , silent , empty — only lights , as [one]232-one saw through the open doors , beyond in [the hall]302-the hall . “ [I]58-leversedge think [I]58-leversedge must have got a bit of a chill , ”[58-leversedge] [Leversedge]58-leversedge remarked . “ [I]58-leversedge expect there 's a lot of damp at night off [the lake]370-the lake , and if [you]57-mr. hammond 've once had a touch of fever it 's likely to lay hold of [you]57-mr. hammond . ”[58-leversedge] Then [we]1505-we went on across [the salon]531-the salon into [the hall]302-the hall , and up the great staircase , slowly , waiting now and then , because [he]58-leversedge shook so badly , to [[Leversedge]58-leversedge 's sedge 's room]1508-leversedge 's sedge 's room on [the first floor]1509-the first floor . [I]0-i remember the impression made on [me]0-i as [I]0-i opened the door of [it]1508-leversedge 's sedge 's room . The effect within was striking ; for there were candles everywhere,—on the chimneypiece , the writing - table , the chest of drawers , by the bedside,—a positive blaze of light , turning [this bachelor bedchamber]1510-this bachelor bedchamber into something curiously suggestive of [a chapelle ardente]1511-a chapelle ardente . [I]0-i suppose [Leversedge]58-leversedge noticed [my]0-i surprise . “ Candles ? Oh yes , ”[58-leversedge] [he]58-leversedge said ; “ [I]58-leversedge always tell [them]2541-them to light a good many like that , now — it 's pleasanter , [you]0-i know , at night . ”[58-leversedge] [He]58-leversedge gazed round [the room]429-the room in a dazed , vacant kind of way . Upon the writing - table stood a folding , leather photograph frame , somewhat worn and travel - stained with much packing . It contained a series of pictures of [Charlotte Perry]65-charlotte , covering quite a number of years , judging by the changing fashion of [her]65-charlotte costume . The last photograph was of very recent date ; [the girl]354-the girl 's charming face set in the aureole of the wide - brimmed , rose - garlanded hat which [she]65-charlotte had worn that morning . [Leversedge]58-leversedge 's wandering glance lighted on these pictures ; and a terrible emotion gripped [his]58-leversedge very vitals . “ [My]58-leversedge love ! ”[58-leversedge] [he]58-leversedge cried out loud,—“my love ! ”[58-leversedge] [His]58-leversedge apathy passed away , and in a moment [he]58-leversedge had turned and spoke to [me]0-i courteously , and with a certain stateliness . “ [You]0-i 're extremely kind , [Hammond]57-mr. hammond , ”[58-leversedge] [he]58-leversedge said , “ and [I]58-leversedge believe [you]57-mr. hammond have always done [your]57-mr. hammond very best for [me]58-leversedge . Most likely [I]58-leversedge shall make use of [your]57-mr. hammond kindness again later ; but just now , for the present , [I]58-leversedge should be glad to be alone . [I]58-leversedge feel [I]58-leversedge am rather [a poor companion]2542-a poor companion , [I]58-leversedge have not much talk in [me]58-leversedge , and [I]58-leversedge have two or three little matters to attend to . [I]58-leversedge 'm awfully obliged to [you]57-mr. hammond — thanks — goodnight . ”[58-leversedge] [I]0-i leaned for a long while out of the window of [[my]0-i bedroom]1771-my bedroom , [downstairs]1890-downstairs , on the ground floor , filled with a vast pity and discontent . The air was very still , an impalpable gloom covered [the garden]291-the garden , the stars were very large , very many , very bright . The miserable little dog still yelped and howled . The Spirit of Fear was still abroad ; it agitated , it distressed [me]0-i . [I]0-i had seen [two people]1517-two people wrecked ; had contributed , precisely how far [I]0-i knew not , [myself]0-i , to [their]1517-two people wrecking . And in so doing had [I]0-i , too , seen that Thing - too - Much , of which [Leversedge]58-leversedge had once spoken ? Had [I]0-i , too , been “ to the end of [the world]1659-the world and looked over the wall , ”[0-i] got to the place from which there is no way out ? These were not agreeable reflections . The hopeless diversity of human character , the hopeless complexity of human relations staggered [me]0-i . Is there absolutely no limit to [our]1518-our misunderstanding of each other , to [our]1518-our torturing of [each other]527-each other , to [our]1518-our boring of [each other]527-each other ? Is there absolutely no safety ? Is every connection , every friendship , every love , liable to reel away , thus , into disaster ? And then , besides these abstract and general fears , very concrete and close ones oppressed [me]0-i . What would the issue of this business be between [Leversedge]58-leversedge and [the Carissima]83-the carissima ? What would to - morrow bring — what , even , to - night ? Suddenly [I]0-i was overtaken by a certain very definite alarm for [Leversedge]58-leversedge , which forced [me]0-i to leave [[my]0-i room]1521-my room , and go forth , down [long passages]1522-long passages , across [the vacant hall]1523-the vacant hall , and up [the wide staircase]1524-the wide staircase once more . Strange vague noises and vague odours saluted [me]0-i , the clinging quiet of [the great house]1525-the great house wrapped [me]0-i about . And a penetrating sense possessed [me]0-i of the common things , the pitiful things , the base things , the delicious things — the unholy revelations , the mystic initiations — which must be taking place , to - night , as every night , behind these ranges of closely closed doors . [The Spirit of Fear]1526-the spirit of fear was abroad [here]1694-here too , with a suggestion of secrets which might not lawfully be looked into . [The crowd]1303-the crowd had broken up into units . Darkness and silence shrouded all . Yet the tragedy , the comedy , the ecstasy , of human life went forward just the same ; all the more strongly and directly , indeed , because now it was hidden and concentrated , because [each individual]1529-each individual had , practically , the whole stage to [himself]1529-each individual . [I]0-i waited outside [[Leversedge]58-leversedge 's room]1530-leversedge 's room , but there was no sound within . The candles were still burning brightly , for a line of vivid light showed beneath the door . Perhaps , worn - out with emotion and fatigue , [he]58-leversedge slept . [I]0-i could but hope so . To wake [him]58-leversedge , if [he]58-leversedge slept , would be cruel ; to intrude upon [him]58-leversedge unasked , if [he]58-leversedge waked , would be impertinent . [I]0-i realised that [my]0-i journey had been a piece of folly . [I]0-i was [an idiot]1982-an idiot to have come . Refreshingly conscious of that fact , [I]0-i turned about and went back . Where were the proud pleasures now , of [preacher]2223-preacher , [director]1533-director , [evangelist]1534-evangelist , which had but so lately puffed up [my]0-i silly soul ? On [my]0-i own lines [I]0-i too had failed — failed as completely as [broken - hearted Leversedge]58-leversedge on [his]58-leversedge , as the heartless Carissima on [hers]1535-hers . [We]1536-we had all played , and [we]1536-we had all lost . [Destiny]196-destiny had swept [our]1536-we stakes into [her]1535-hers lap , as is [Destiny]196-destiny 's habit ; and left [us]1536-we , each in [our]1536-we several ways , penniless . [We]1536-we had each , in [our]1536-we several ways , asked the impossible of the other , with this inevitable , this very gratifying result ! And [I]0-i — [I]0-i , at least , from [my]0-i detached standpoint ought to have known better , seen clearer . For , what the devil is the use of standing aside from the battle of life , unless by so doing [you]1537-you keep a steady enough head and lively enough perceptions , to see how the battle is going , and to be able to foresee the result ? [My]0-i conceit of [myself]0-i was wounded to the death . It is an humiliating confession to make , since [I]0-i perceive it brings [my]0-i habitual light - mindedness into rather lurid prominence , but [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i had ever felt actively and personally miserable , until now , as [I]0-i shut the great casements of [my]0-i window together , and reflected that there was no help to be given either to the sinned against or the sinning ; that there was positively nothing more to be done save to wait the event . Ah ! is it not a pity , after all , [we]1536-we have grown so wise , in these latter days , that [we]1536-we regard religion merely as a subject of interesting speculation ; that [we]1536-we have ceased to have faith in [the demigods , who were agreeably accessible , comfortably near to [us]1536-we]1538-the demigods , who were agreeably accessible , comfortably near to us ; and have retained only a barren , because only a controversial , belief in [the Great God who sits behind the Creeds]1539-the great god who sits behind the creeds ? For [the adept]1540-the adept , no doubt , [He]1540-the adept represents the final rest , the final beatitude ; but , for the rank and file of [us]1536-we , [He]1540-the adept is chillingly far away , too unthinkably great to be of much immediate use in poor little twopenny - halfpenny human extremity . [I]0-i would so thankfully have said a prayer , for [my]0-i unworthy and futile self ; for [[my]0-i poor dear friend]1541-my poor dear friend [Leversedge]58-leversedge ; even for [Charlotte née Perry]65-charlotte , [that most unheroic daughter of [a voracious rat and excellent suburban clock - moon]1543-a voracious rat and excellent suburban clock - moon]1542-that most unheroic daughter of a voracious rat and excellent suburban clock - moon , in this [her]65-charlotte hour of self - knowledge , conscious nakedness and nothingness . But how could [I]0-i , in reason , do so ? Who was [I]0-i that [I]0-i should be heard ? What [my]0-i petitions , that [they]1544-they should obtain to change the course of history ? What would be , would be . [My]0-i pitiful wishes weighed as a feather against the push of Fate . No doubt such meditations are healthful for [the soul]1545-the soul , rich with wholesome discipline ; but , [ye]1546-ye powers ! they are quite detestably unpleasant all the same . And so , realising the futility of [myself]0-i and [my]0-i endeavours , [I]0-i declined upon bathos . [I]0-i went to bed . Still worse , [I]0-i , being most abominably tired , went to sleep . [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i slept heavily , yet [I]0-i remember the yapping and howling of a dog mingling with [my]0-i dreams , now taking on an almost human sound of appeal and reproachful lamentation , now passing into a cry of mere animal distress . [I]0-i was roused at last by a very real and definite outcry under [my]0-i window , emphasised by a shower of little pebbles against the shutters . The dawn had just warmed into sunrise . [The waiters]1582-the waiters had neglected to clear away the remains of [Mr. Perry]84-mr. perry 's supper , and a flight of sparrows and chaffinches rose , squeaking and chirruping , off the table from among the wet ice - plates and remnants of lobster salad , as [we]1579-we passed by . [The spare young Russian woman]1583-the spare young russian woman , very much en déshabille , [her]1583-the spare young russian woman magnificent hair all over [her]1583-the spare young russian woman angular shoulders , hung out of a fourth - floor window , crooning one of those infinitely pathetic folk - songs which seem so full of the sadness of long snow - bound winters and the hopeless monotony of [the Steppe]28-the steppe . Otherwise [we]1579-we happily met [no one]440-no one , saw [no one]440-no one — save [the yawning lift - boy]1586-the yawning lift - boy — till [we]1579-we reached [[Leversedge]119-leversedge 's room]1530-leversedge 's room and laid [him]119-leversedge on [his]119-leversedge bed . Some of the many candles were still burning . They flared low in the socket . The window had been left partly open behind the wooden shutters , and the draught had taken them , so that they had guttered from the edge of the candlesticks into great shrouds . The air was heavy — notwithstanding the partly open window — with an acrid smell of burnt paper , burnt leather . As [we]1579-we opened the door [I]0-i observed a whirl of tinder fly up from the hearthstone , and settle back slowly , in black hovering flakes , on the furniture and the white counterpane of the bed . The folding - screen and all the photographs of [the Carissima]83-the carissima had disappeared . On the writing - table a copy of [Vanity Fair]96-vanity fair lay open at that pathetic page of the last chapter of the book , wherein [Major Dobbin]197-major dobbin — after long waiting — at last has [his]197-major dobbin desire , and leanness withal , as one fears , in [his]197-major dobbin soul .
